Title: Allow sending an attachment without having to download and re-upload it
Description:
If the user gets an attachment part of email A, then they want to send the same attachment as part of a new email. Currently the client has to download the attachment, then upload it and use the assigned uploadId as the sending attachmentId.

JJ's comment in HipChat:
we may implement this as a general feature, using some kind of global URI. in the global URI we'll include account ID as well, and possibly account type.
that way you can just specify a URI to any file reference such as in another email account or in Dropbox
once we implement Dropbox and multi-email account implementation this becomes useful.

2. The second change is to do this after compose is shown, not before, since this download's purpose is purely for the purpose of local preview.

Title: Need to pass client response times to NewRelic via frontend/python
Description:
Today NewRelic's mobile support is only for HTTP so doesn't support a TCP connection or Thrift. http://newrelic.com/mobile-monitoring

We still need a way to track the client side of the transaction, so in the mean time can we pass back this data via the FE or is there a raw API we can implement from iOS that will go direct to NewRelic?

Feels like the FE approach is better so we don't add additional network calls from the iOS device that may slow it down.

Title: Create 3 node system
Description:
Original Ticket Number: AC-325

Original Ticket Type: Sub-task

Reporter: Kevin Henrikson

Original Components:
Operations
Comments:
Jira Comment History:

Doug Kent on 2013-09-24 17:52:54 (+0000):

For FrontEnd server, please use Small EC2 instance type and attach an EBS volume 100 GB in size. The EBS volume will be used for logging, which can get pretty huge, as FE logs both the response from backend AND the message sent to the client. By using a Small EC2 instance, which is 1 EC unit, we can hopefully measure and estimate the "concurrent users per EC unit", allowing us to determine scalability needs as we grow.



Mike Deeks on 2013-09-24 18:08:59 (+0000):

Good idea. I'll be setting these up today. That amount of logging will be scary as we grow. Invaluable right now as we're building things of course. But later on we'll probably want to limit logging of outgoing requests. Or at least start rotating away logs at a faster rate. I've seen outages happen multiple times due to disk fulls, so heavy logging scares me now. I'll keep that in my notes as something to track in the future.



Doug Kent on 2013-09-24 18:13:56 (+0000):

Agreed. Right now, all logging is in the most verbose form. Going forward, we'll trim it down for sure. Let me know if you have any questions on the FE setup.



Kevin Henrikson on 2013-09-24 21:55:07 (+0000):

For the Ubuntu versions going forward should we grab the latest from here? Not a big deal but once we built out our templates may want to have an easy way to lock the exact AMI we use as the base or the source of the AMIs.

http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/locator/ec2/

ie:
us-west-2 precise 12.04 LTS amd64 ebs 20130909 ami-8635a9b6 aki-fc37bacc
https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/home?region=us-west-2#launchAmi=ami-8635a9b6



Mike Deeks on 2013-09-24 22:08:59 (+0000):

Probably a good idea. I went off of the latest LTS release listed in the marketplace. It is the same release number but the release date listed is older. Then again as long as we build from the same version and keep it up to date with apt we should be good.



Kevin Henrikson on 2013-09-24 22:16:13 (+0000):

Yep true. I suspect it's just got more of the patches rolled-up. I did notice most of our server warning about lots of updates. So I suspect we aren't running those today.



Mike Deeks on 2013-09-24 22:39:16 (+0000):

Yeah I saw that too. Thats high on my list of things to do



Kevin Henrikson on 2013-09-24 22:43:24 (+0000):

Also re: availability zones do we want to keep them all in the same ie us-west-2c I see the new backend/search VMs are in us-west-2b but frontend is in us-west-2a. If we can keep them in all the same zone for dev/beta VMs it may be easier to manage reserved instances as those are tied to a zone when you buy them for the year.



Mike Deeks on 2013-09-24 22:56:39 (+0000):

Ah good point. I didn't know that actually. I chose no preference for the zone since we're single servers all around at the moment. I'll recreate it in the same zone as the others.



Mike Deeks on 2013-09-26 22:44:23 (+0000):

Running and successfully tested.

frontend.beta.acompli.org
backend.beta.acompli.org
search.beta.acompli.org

Operations

Mike Deeks on 2013-09-26 22:51:25 (+0000):

It's working but Bamboo is not very good at this. It doesn't understand that a single artifact (backend for example) can be deployed to multiple servers/environments. Also I have to duplicate all of the tasks for each environment we create. Some of the tasks are buggy. I think ultimately I'll switch us to a different tool like Jenkins. I have used it extensively and it has all sorts of plugins for Atlassian stuff like Hipchat.



Kevin Henrikson on 2013-09-26 23:13:17 (+0000):

Ugg 😀 we've got support so if you see issues or have problems we should file bugs/tickets. So far they've been pretty good at least responding or trying find work arounds etc. I really don't want to get another tool to host/run for this since we'll need to do all the work to integrate things and lose all the audit/tracking we now have as it's tighter in Atlassian world right now.

Feels like if all the deploy is scripted or puppet controlled then the code/steps in bamboo should be nothing more than a trigger to kick off the process and pick up the build.



Mike Deeks on 2013-09-30 21:42:15 (+0000):

After thinking about it a bit I think I agree. Lets stick with Bamboo for now. Its slow, buggy in some places, and a pain in the butt to setup, but once it is working its fine. The tight integration with Jira and Bitbucket are nice.

Title: Show next message or go back to list when message is deleted?
Description:
Currently when a message is deleted by tapping on the trash case icon in the message detail view, we go back to the previous list view. It is the conversation view if the deleted message was in a conversation with multiple messages. But if message was not in a conversation we go back to the conversation list view. To read the next new message the user must do an extra tap. It would nice to navigate to the next message/conversation automatically.

More generally, if a message is deleted and there are more messages in the conversation, show the conversation. If the deleted message was the last message in the conversation, show the next conversation.

The next conversation may be the earlier one (down the list) or newer one (up the list). Or it could be dynamic based on the remaining unread conversations. I personally like going down the list unconditionally. That seems more predictable and easier to understand.

Diego Basch on 2013-09-30 04:24:14 (+0000):

I may be able to fix this particular instance by making contacts seen in email weigh more than the ones from the address books, but I'd caution against focusing too much on relevance at this stage. Let me explain why.

This is a pattern that I've experienced with every search system I've built:

  • once the initial system works, the stakeholders find queries that don't return the expected results
  • the team fixes those, at the expense of added complexity
  • the stakeholders discover new queries that don't return the expected results
  • the fixes made to please the stakeholders don't necessarily improve the experience of actual users

The right way to approach search relevance is to establish metrics for user satisfaction, e.g.

  • number of keystrokes until the user chooses a result
  • percentage of abandoned queries
  • average position of the result chosen by a user

With some metrics in place and real-life query data, it's possible to A/B test parameters / algorithms, and to have a quantitative answer to the question: is algorithm A better than algorithm B. Also, relevance algorithms typically incorporate feedback from the user: e.g. if you're always choosing the third result for a query, that result should rank higher than results 1 and 2 so it gets promoted. Relevance algorithms that don't incorporate user feedback tend to be overly complex and perform comparatively poorly.

As a prerequisite, we need a stable search system that works predictably. I would advise against hacking relevance algorithms before having a long-term owner of the search system who understands the tradeoffs involved. Because we're entering the last few weeks of my contract, I will focus on stabilizing the search system (no search because of a bug is worse than results that are not as good as Gmail's). I will only make relevance improvements if they are very simple and low risk.



Kevin Henrikson on 2013-09-30 20:42:15 (+0000):

If it's trivial to make the contacts from email show higher than contacts from the address book that would fix this for most users and just about all the cases I can think of.

Beth Miles on 2014-02-06 22:22:53 (+0000):

Ogden Kent Swapnil Jadhav, The file named bulk-edit.png showing three screens is the latest design:

  • User taps "Edit"
    • Checkboxes slide in to the left of message list
    • Bulk edit options appear in nav bar. "Cancel' is the only enabled action
  • User selects a message
    • All actions become enabled

Actions from left to right:
"x" is cancel -> Canceling takes user back to message list

"o" is read/unread -> If all selected messages are read, mark as unread. If all are unread, marks as read. If both read and unread are selected, default action is mark as unread. (NOTE: This could get confusing. Willing to get the functionality out there and get feedback . On a future iteration, we might want to consider using mail.app's approach which uses an action sheet.)

"flag" flags the messages

"file" is move -> opens up a modal with folder list

"trash" --> deletes message

"box" --> Archives message

Tab Bar - if a user happens to navigate to a different tab during this operation, the state is preserved.

You need to stick that code (from stackoverflow) in the controllers, and then have it call the helper when shake happens:

  • (void)motionEnded:(UIEventSubtype)motion withEvent:(UIEvent *)event

the helper basically creates a screenshot from the view (there is a better way in iOS7), and then fires up the mail controller.

Title: dup accounts created if login with alias
Description:
3:24 PM Kevin Henrikson: @JJ check out the two accounts for Dybik. Looks like we connected to his account twice. ie he used a different URL and alias to connect each time. Folders are identical so I suspect it's a dup. I wonder if there is any way to detect/prevent that.
3:25 PM JJ Zhuang: ha
3:26 PM JJ Zhuang: yup indeed
jon.dybik@zimbra.com is his canonical
and jon@zimbra.com is an alias
not sure how we can avoid this kind of dup
there may be a way, but need to do some research.
so if the account was from autodiscover we have a chance
as I believe EAS autodiscover can optionally return the canonical address of the account
3:29 PM Kevin Henrikson: Yes, just something odd I saw. No action needed now, but at scale this will hurt us a bit
3:29 PM JJ Zhuang: but in this case @zimbra.com is not from autodiscover
so not sure what we can do for this case.
3:29 PM Kevin Henrikson: Yep, feels like we could maybe fingerprint these based on the folder/msg count and de-dup or normalize on the backend.
But not for now, just to be aware it's happening and possible
3:30 PM JJ Zhuang: for now just slap him 😀
ask him to stick to a single email address
3:33 PM JJ Zhuang: ok @KevinHenrikson there may be a way
there's a Settings command on EAS
it can optionally return a user's SMTPAddress
so maybe right after login before we create mailbox we run that command to get the canonical address

JJ Zhuang on 2014-04-28 22:31:00 (+0000):

Former user

EmailNotPrimary - user supplied email does not match the "primary" address we retrieved from Exchange.
EmailNoMatch - Exchange provided a number of aliases with no indication of "primary", and user supplied email doesn't match any of them.



JJ Zhuang on 2014-04-28 22:36:33 (+0000):

Former user please also add a thrift call to retrieve a list of aliases from Account.getAliases(). Note that it can return either null or empty String[].



Former user on 2014-04-29 21:42:02 (+0000):

"ac-480" backend branch has the thrift changes for AC-480 and AC-2785.

git commit comment:

AC-480, AC-2785 Added 4 new thrift error codes, 2 for Exchange alias-related problems and 2 for Gmail problems.

EmailAddressNotPrimary: email supplied by user is not the primary address of Exchange account
EmailAddressMismatch: email supplised by user does not match the primary address or any of the aliases defined on the Exchagne account
GmailTooManyConnections: Gmail complains there are too many simultaneous connections.
GmailImapDisabled: Google Apps domain has IMAP disabled; user should talk to his Google Apps admin.

getAccountInfo call returns the aliases of an Exchange account in the new TAccountInfo.aliases optional field.



Former user on 2014-04-29 23:15:49 (+0000):

Backend fix has been merged to release and develop branches.



Doug Kent on 2014-04-30 14:39:16 (+0000):

Former user
1. Aliases are only for Exchange, right? How are we handling Google Apps aliases?
2. What happens if the user changes her aliases? Do we ever refresh account info?



Former user on 2014-04-30 15:48:05 (+0000):

1. Yes, they're Exchange only. I don't know if there's a way to fetch google aliases in BE. If we had them though, they'd be returned in the same way. For now Exchange only.
2. I don't think the use can change aliases. Only the Exchange admin can. JJ Zhuang do we refresh at all?



Doug Kent on 2014-05-01 22:22:19 (+0000):

Notes to client developer (Ogden Kent, Keith Lazuka):
1. Use PrimaryEmail from AuthenticateResponse_161 as the account's email address. Don't use the email you sent on the request, as it could be incorrect.
2. Use Aliases from AuthenticateResponse_161 so user doesn't include self in ReplyAll, when an alias is present.
3. Although not used yet, please hook in ErrorText from response, so that future auth errors can quickly be supported on client, prior to new app build. Current method sends InvalidAuth, as well as MessageToClientUpdate_150 with details of auth failure.

Need to chat with JJ Zhuang about best way to test all of these. Probably need to have this ready for weekend QA teams to test old app build and new app build.

Comments:

Sarang Vyas on 2013-12-28 05:42:23 (+0000):

I changed my password from outlook365 for more than 24 hours ago but have not got any prompt or error in the app.
The mail syncing was working for me for few hours, but after 24 hours new mails are not showing up. Probably an unauthenticated error should be shown in the app.

Logged bug AC-1034 as duplicate of this so you can have a look at the logs.



JJ Zhuang on 2014-01-07 20:41:00 (+0000):

Doug Kent I tested various password change scenarios. BE should now return TAuthError on all auth failures including cases caused by password change on Exchange and Gamil. Note that to test gmail case you need to login to gmail account and revoke the oauth grant. Please make sure auth failure is passed back to app and prompt user to re-enter password. Thanks!



Doug Kent on 2014-01-07 20:42:17 (+0000):

Sounds good. I'll tackle in the coming days.



Doug Kent on 2014-01-07 20:44:09 (+0000):

JJ Zhuang - For authentications that originally required the user to enter their server information, I'm guessing you don't need that a again for password update, correct?



JJ Zhuang on 2014-01-07 20:44:25 (+0000):

Notes to Ogden Kent/Bryan Sawler regarding password change. For the gmail case we'll need to get user back into the oauth flow.



JJ Zhuang on 2014-01-07 20:50:56 (+0000):

Doug Kent for exchange ideally we want to give user the option to update server. Although rare, this can happen for Exchange users when an administrator moves a user from one server host to another. That will fail auth with the original server host, and if we don't allow user to update host they can't log back in again. That's why Mail.app does allow user to update anything.

So for the UI ideally on telling user auth failure we should give user a way to go to the detailed login view and update anything they want, including server host, domain, username, etc.

This doesn't apply to Gmail. For Gmail just need to allow them to go back to the oauth flow.



Doug Kent on 2014-01-07 21:01:08 (+0000):

JJ Zhuang - in that case, should we show them the existing server host, domain, username info? If so, does that mean the client should save those locally? Is there any security issue with doing so?

Also, should we ever allow user to update their credentials PRIOR to BE requesting those changes from the client? Is there a situation where the user would need/want to do that?



JJ Zhuang on 2014-01-07 21:07:38 (+0000):

Doug Kent Answer is yes to both.

Regarding security concern, the more critical info is really the password. We shouldn't store the password locally. So if they need to update anything we need to make user re-type the password. Showing other info is fine. Same behavior as Mail.app but Mail.app also stores password locally so we are already doing better there. We may at some point in the future revisit this if our IT customers want us to hide server info but right now we don't need to worry about that part. Right now better make it convenient to the user.



Doug Kent on 2014-01-21 01:37:06 (+0000):

Pushed to change_password branch on FE. Dev branch on BE should work fine. Grab new Thrifts for Authenticate call. Send in AccountID, FolderHierarchySyncKey, and SyncStates for that account upon Authenticate. You'll receive RefreshAccountPasswordUpdate_124 when password need updating. Account will be removed from active session. Calls to that account ID will fail gracefully.



Sarang Vyas on 2014-01-28 08:21:38 (+0000):

Tested on 0.14.0 build 100318 with exchange and the app asks for updating the password.

Tested this for my personal gmail account as well as test account but the app never prompts for updating the password.
I have updated my personal gmail accounts password before 2 days and still there is no error in app.
Logs for test done on simulator for acomplipune1@gmail.com attached.



Doug Kent on 2014-01-28 19:07:04 (+0000):

Sarang Vyas I don't think changing the gmail password will prompt for a new login, as authorization is controlled via OAuth. You probably need to revoke OAuth access in your Google security settings.

https://security.google.com/settings/security/permissions?pli=1

@JJ - please confirm that I'm not missing something here.



Ogden Kent on 2014-01-28 19:54:20 (+0000):

To test gmail, you need to revoke your auth ticket and then go into JMX (https://tools.acompli.net/jmx/dev/backend/) and do a closeMailbox().



Ogden Kent on 2014-02-01 23:20:46 (+0000):

Sarang Vyas Please test this again on Gmail so we can put it to bed. As I stated, you'll have to kick the account using JMX (see my previous comment). I'm confident this is completed.



Sarang Vyas on 2014-02-03 07:40:07 (+0000):

To test this I first revoked auth token from google and then did closeMailbox for my gmail account and the app prompted for login again.
So yes, this is working as desired but how would user come to know that he has to go through this process?
From end user perspective he would never get a prompt from updating password (which he will expect as compared to other apps like mail or mailbox) by the app unless he deletes and re-configures the account.

So how are we going to handle this?



Ogden Kent on 2014-02-05 17:46:27 (+0000):

Sarang Vyas The revoked auth ticket will eventually be picked up by our backend server. It just takes some time (a few days?) for the change to propagate. If you want, you can doing it the right way, be revoking the ticket and then seeing how long it takes for the app to prompt for reauth.



JJ Zhuang on 2014-02-05 17:56:05 (+0000):

Once a ticket is revoked, the next authentication with Gmail will fail. However that depends on when the next authentication is as the server maintains a keepalive connection with Gmail. Usually you should see the auth failure in a few hours.

Title: Improve nightly keyword generation and contact scraping logic
Description:
Currently we have nightly job that runs once a day and updates each user's keyword and contact indices. The way it's currently implemented today, every night it fetches some arbitrary number of emails (currently set to 250) from Elasticsearch main index, then performs analysis on keyword relevancy on the subject and sender.

First improvement we can make is instead of recalculating keywords for everyone every night, the analysis can be data driven. Some people may receive hundreds of new emails per day, and others may receive a dozen or so. We can have the keyword analysis to be done after certain number of new messages, which will be different for each users based on how many emails they each receive.

We can also look at the performance aspect. Right now in order to do keyword analysis we perform search on Elasticsearch to get source document, convert JSON object to Java, and extract field values. Since the source document is also stored in mongodb, we can perform MapReduce on the mailitems directly.

For the performance I've taken some measurements using Enron Corpus email database which contains about 0.5 million messages. I've populated mongodb with 500 thousand messages and Elasticsearch with 100 thousand messages and performed keyword analysis.

Attached are three charts comparing the time it takes to perform the same analysis using mongodb MapReduce and Elasticsearch. The first chart plots time vs # of messages processed. The slope is steeper than it really is since X axis is in log scale where Y axis is linear. The second and third graphs have both X and Y axis in log scale. The charts show that both mongodb and Elasticsearch scale linearly as the # of messages increase. mongodb performs better when the # of messages is small. At 100K messages mongodb MapReduce is still faster than Elasticsearch but by smaller margin.



Original Ticket Number: AC-519

Original Ticket Type: Improvement

Reporter: Jong Lee

Original Components:
Backend
Comments:
Jira Comment History:

Jong Lee on 2013-11-19 00:37:34 (+0000):

As part of this restructure we should fix the bug where the ranking data is aged out only when the contact is recently used. When we have data driven contact scraping, each iteration should keep boosting the ranking for the contact who the user have sent or received emails from. Then after a while the system should age out the ranking for everyone and normalize the relevancy scale used for ranking. Right now the ranking normalization is done for contacts that we are adjusting the relevancy for. So if a contact hasn't sent or received email from the user, then that contact will escape the system wide normalization, and incorrectly end up with relatively higher ranks.



Jong Lee on 2014-01-23 22:01:28 (+0000):

Holding off using MapReduce with Postgres migration. Contact scraping and ranking recalculation is now done on the fly.

Title: No room to type into when replying to an email with multiple recipients
Description:
I originally saw this problem on iPhone 4S with shorter screen, but the problem should be reproducible on iPhone 5 if there are more recipients.

Go into message detail view of an email that has several recipients and do Reply All. The composer comes up with To, Cc, and Bcc fields expanded. Subject is also visible and now there are buttons for Calendar and Attach above the keyboard. With all those things shown, there is no vertical room left to show the body text area.



Original Ticket Number: AC-612

Original Ticket Type: Bug

Reporter: Former user

Original Components:
iOS
Comments:
Jira Comment History:

Beth Miles on 2013-11-08 17:25:45 (+0000):

Here are the interaction details: Message body should be docked to the top of the screen. Recipient/Cc/Bcc fields should be hidden by default and available when a user scrolls. Gmail app is a great example to follow: To help the user understand where the fields are, they use a transition to show the fields then scroll the body to the top of the screen.



Kevin Henrikson on 2014-01-08 01:17:51 (+0000):

Beth Miles I disagree. We should follow the mail.app model you need to see the to/cc/from upon landing on the reply/reply-all page. this is critical to see who you are sending the email to exactly. Especially when you come from our thread view that doesn't show all the recipients.

Hiding the to/cc like we do now really only shows two lines one blank line (under sig) and then the 'load full message' note.



Former user on 2014-01-08 02:04:57 (+0000):

If we're going to show the keyboard, the line with the caret should be in view. It just looks wrong to have the keyboard up and the current line invisible. We can remove bcc and put subject above to/cc so that to/cc and the current line can be in view together. (though subject above to/cc may feel unconventional) Also, we're losing too much screen height to the Calendar/Attach buttons.



Kevin Henrikson on 2014-01-08 13:38:08 (+0000):

Agreed we can make the attach/cal buttons smaller (I'd pref a little icon vs the boxer style button)

Jiho what does this look like for you on mail.app to reply to a similar email with a to and cc?



Former user on 2014-01-08 17:34:31 (+0000):

Mail.app lists things in this order: the menu bar (with "Cancel <subject> Send"), To, Cc, Bcc, From (because I have multiple accounts defined), Subject, text body, and finally the keyboard. Upon choosing Reply All it showed the top of the list briefly to show to/cc, then content below the menu bar scrolled down to bring the caret line in view just above the keyboard. Bcc was shown at the top at this point. This is consistent with what Beth said about Gmail.app in her 11/8 comment.



Kevin Henrikson on 2014-01-08 19:22:10 (+0000):

A quick show of the to/cc and then a slow scroll to the cursor would be ok with me. The key thing is I need to see the to/cc before I start to type even if just for a short sec.

Or possibly the mockapp isn't failing correctly. In either case, I'll need some help debugging. Removing myself to tackle some lower hanging fruit.

It's not exactly fast, but I'm getting a few repros by just running mbu test a lot:


mbu test -debug -verbose -iterations 100 -suite mockapp_mac_inproc_always_pass ai_mockapps debug

I've had a repro of this on my own dev machine with the TerminateApp step and was able to look at it in real time.

As far as the playerActions.log is concerned, the mac actions have done all of their work (MacMockApp is quit).

Title: Planner CM-0105 Review 3/19/2019
Description:
CM-0105: The organization reviews and updates the baseline configuration of the information system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

OSI Definition: OSI - Partners must document any OS level changes in their code and review these changes at least annually or if there is a significant change.

Attendees: AdamO, KyleWhit, AmyGlave, SuSukum, xiaojliu, RyanY, DaMoksha, NiSteidl, SaBarnet, TarkanSe, OscarG

We do not currently make any OS Configuration level changes, accepting all of the settings as provided to us by Azure and OSI, except as noted below.

All of our other configuration changes, like threading settings, ASP timeout settings, or installing the reverse proxy, are at the application level.

Specifically, we do not modify FIPS settings.

Changes:
  • We have enabled GCP/Kevlar for our product in 18548325. (This is inherited from OSI, but we had to opt in.)
  • We enabled .NET system default TLS versions - .NET will do what the OS thinks is right
    • As specified as a security practice here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/network-programming/tls#systemdefaulttlsversions
  • We enabled .NET using only strong crypto protocols - also informs .NET in interacting with the OS, asking the OS to use strong crypto
    • As specified here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/network-programming/tls#schusestrongcrypto
These changes are part of our product definition, and not local to machines - so, we don't need to manually set these in new environments where we deploy.
Comments: @Adam Outcalt The parent feature got Closed or Removed. Removing this. Reactivate and reparent if necessary.

Title: Mac Word: macro recording of Advanced Find and Replace does not work
Description:
This bug was reported by a customer in the Mac IT Admins slack channel. The scenario works in WinWord and fails on the Mac.

1) Launch DEBUG Word
2) type "=rand()" to put some text in the document
3) Tools/Macro/Record Macro...
4) Accept the default macro name, but you may want to change the target document to be the current doc1 instead of your Normal
5) Click OK to start recording
6) Edit menu / Find / Advanced Find and Replace...
7) Click on the Replace tab in the Find dialog
8) Click in the Find What field and type a word that is currently in your document (such as 'provides' for the default random text)
9) Click in the Replace With field and type some different word
10) Click on Replace All
11) Click on OK in the occurrences alert
12) Click on Close in the Replace dialog
13) Tools / Macro / Stop Recording
14) Tools / Macro / Macros
15) Select Macro1 and click Edit

BUG: Notice that the macro didn't record the actual find/replace, but did record some debug diagnostics:

'DEBUG WARNING:
    'COULDN'T DETERMINE VB SYNTAX FOR THIS COMMAND BECAUSE NO
    'APPROPRIATE CLAUSE IN FCITOOB.SPC COULD BE FOUND WITH THESE ARGUMENTS:
    '   fci = 117; WB = EditReplace; sab = 2; tmc = [UNSPECIFIED]; CAB command? _
        1;
    '   20 arguments = {Find="provides", Replace="bozo", Direction=0, MatchCase= _
        0, WholeWord=0, PatternMatch=0, SoundsLike=0, Format=0, Wrap=1, _
        FindAllWordForms=0, MatchByte=0, MatchByte=0, FuzzyFind=0, Destination="" _
        , CorrectEnd=0, MatchKashida=0, MatchDiacritics=0, MatchAlefHamza=0, _
        MatchControl=0, PhoneticHangul=0}
    '   Log:
    '   - Attempting to match goal with clause(s)...
    '   - [MATCH ATTEMPT 1: ipfn=-1: fCab=1: fWB=0]
    '   - Goal has too many arguments for clause.
    '   - Don't know how to record arg "MatchByte". (iag=40,iarm=10)

In Ship builds, it doesn't do much of anything.  Looks like there's a mismatch between shared code and the Mac fcitoob.spc data.

Instructions for moderators (ver: 1.3)

 

STEPS FOR BUG EVALUATION

Please follow steps below to evaluate the bug:

 

1. If the feedback/issue in Description fields is not in English, please provide the translation under “Discussion” field

2. Decide if the feedback is valid:

 

2.1. If the feedback is not justified, change the state to “Resolved”, select “Not Repro” in the field “Resolved Reason” and provide the explanation in the “Discussion” field. Make sure to assign the bug back to “OISGMajordomo” alias.

 

2.2. If the bug is justified and the issue described can be located:

a. Choose “Ling” tab and fill in required fields:

• Linguistic impact

• DQF Error Type

• DQF Specific Error

• Root cause

• Additional comment (if necessary)

b. Decide if it is a world readiness issue (with high probability that the issue will apply for other languages as well). If yes, please provide a detailed explanation in a “Discussion” field and add new tag “xLanguage_candidate”

c. Decide if the issue is worth fixing in an already released products (Office 2016 + Office 2013) by using SE_S1 ; SE_S2 ; SE_S3 or SE_S4 tag. This only applies to issues, which contain tag SharePoint or where Release group equals Desktop (Windows). Please find more information about this process on the following site (focus on section B. NEW BUGS):

https://portal.moravia.com/prj/officegroup/Linguistics/ModeratorSection/Moderator%20Kit%20Mainstream/Instructions%20for%20backporting.aspx

d. Decide if bug affects an approved term in Term Studio and if GTC is required.

  1. If there is no approved term in Term Studio (the concept does not exist), tag the VSTS item with tag “TS_SourceTerm_Candidate”

  2. If GTC is required, file a request to the GTC list

  3. If source or targets does not have any Office products in P/T, tag the VSTS item with tag “TS_AddSourcePT_Candidate” or “AddTargetPT_Candidate”

e. Decide if this is a consistency issue and evaluate how many occurrences need to be changed.

f. Assess whether the “priority” is accurate by referring to the bug priority classification

 

2.3 If the feedback is justified but the issue mentioned in the feedback no longer exists in files, describe the situation under the “Discussion” field, and assign bug to “VT_Moravia” for further validation.

 

3. If you have doubts regarding the validity of the bug or need more information, please assign the bug back to “OISG Majordomo” alias and request more details under the “Discussion” field.

4. If you need to review occurrences before deciding and you are unable to access Fabric or a file, you may assign the bug to VT_Moravia and ask the team to locate the occurrences for you. (Please note in case of UA (Articles), an Internet search can provide additional content – no Resource IDs are needed). Make sure to describe what steps have been taken so far under the “Discussion” field.

 

STEPS FOR BUG RESOLUTION

Resolving UI bug

 

If the language moderator is 100% sure where to locate the string, then s/he implements the fix directly in LEAF FOR THE SPECIFIC PRODUCT/PROJECT only.

 

If you are unsure reach out to the LSX PM in Microsoft. Do not forget to always provide ResID and File Name under the “Discussion” field. Change the state to “Resolved” and assign the bug to VT_Moravia for regression. If language moderators are not 100% sure about the implementation results, they keep the bug as “Active”, provide the resolution in the “Discussion” field, and assign the bug to VT_Moravia, who will implement the fix instead.

Resolving UA bug

 

Language moderator adds the evaluation results in the “Discussion” field, changes the path to GSX/Modern Assistance/INTL Production/, as well as the appropriate sub-node, for example, IW_Articles, Templates, Video etc, and assigns the bug to VT_Moravia for implementation.

 

In any case (for both UI and UA bugs), the language moderator should simultaneously add/update Term Studio entries as necessary.

 

For more details on global term change, please refer to the GTC process:

 

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/OISGPortal/linguistic/Moderator%20Kit/Global%20Term%20Change%20(GTC).aspx

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/OISGPortal/linguistic/_layouts/15/start.aspx#/Moderator%20Kit/Term%20change%20management%20in%20TS.aspx

Title: Q1 FY20  CP experiences - Win32
Description:
Launch content experiences in-app (Win32) to amplify messaging and Support Key Apps/Features that Drive Engagement/Productivity. 


ADO NOTE: As the intent is for content programming to be self-serve, this epic does not have assigned resources for PM, EM, or SWE Project Lead and "People" is set to=N/A.


Launch content experiences on Win32 to amplify messaging and Support Key Apps/Features that Drive Engagement/Productivity using "self-serve" processes. "Using 'self-serve' processes" means that the currently available channels are Business Bar (CTA to URL or IAD) and HPB (CTA to URL or IAD), current triggers are very limited (typically on-boot), current segments are broadly consumer and B-SKU (SMB) with some session variables available. That said, plans will include requirements for additional channels, capabilities within the channels, triggers, and  targeting to inform engineering's roadmap.

Title: Consider blocking moves of SGs containing a section with a page with an upload in progress across notebooks
Description:
It is by design that we do not block this now as it would require use to traverse the page content of every page in every section of the section groups. 

It is fine to move section groups within the same notebook, because our node identifier only considers the notebook and section, no intermediate folders.

Description:
Recent changes to the Binary Store Driver broke our ability to build WacSetupAutoPilotRelDomino or WacSetupRel projects. WacSetupRel is a renamed version of WacSetupAutoPilotRelDomino and WacSetupAutoPilotRelDomino is in the process of
being deprecated.

To fix things I have authored the same fix in the following two DPKs:
\\UC-DEV-09\W02_WAC_2\cr\17964497_01.dpk For WacSetupRel
\\UC-DEV-09\W02_WAC_2\cr\17958371_01.dpk For WacSetupAutoPilotRelDomino.

My intention is to only check in the fix for WacSetupRel (as WacSetupAutoPilotRelDomino is being deprecated).

The issue I am having is that the fix work just fine for WacSetupAutoPilotRelDomino but fails for WacSetupRel and it is a fix in WacSetupRel that is needed.

Here is the link to my failed CB buddy build: https://b/build/63866a08-f367-4b47-add1-44315f420d89

WacSetupRel produces the following Error:
[1:00] error DX0500: [PipC3B2234F9BB9BD2B, {Running static nmake for wacsetuprel_x64_debug_en-us (MetaBuild|wacsetuprel|x64_debug_en-us)}] - Disallowed file accesses were detected (R = read, W = write):
Disallowed file accesses performed by: C:\windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe
R E:\WAC_2\Build\projectdata.bin

Questions:
The domino logs reference a pip that failed and the line of DSC. How to I correlate the dsc back to my NMake?
Why would the same fix work for one project but not the other when they are essentially the same project – just renamed?

-Chris

Title: Date formats don't respect the Australian locale
Description:
This was reported by a customer.

repro steps:
  1. Go to Project
  2. change your locale to EN-AU for Australia
  3. go to a project and look at the dates
Actual:
Date format is the same as EN-US

Expected:
Dates to be in Australian date format. If you change to EN-GB, you correctly get British formats. ES-ES works for Spanish/Spain, etc.

This repros for Project and Roadmap
Comments: Issue Linked to OCV by: hocull@microsoft.com
Looks like we just need to add en-au to the locales list

Title: SA: Customer Feedback bugs are not regressed in case of Teams/Skype involved
Description:
Customer (internal or external) Feedback bugs are all regressed after being fixed for GSX Tenants/Products.
When Customer feedback has been logged under GSX and Skype/Teams is involved the bug is ported to skypelocalization.visualstudio.com/Localization where follows the process defined in wiki (https://skypelocalization.visualstudio.com/Localization/_wiki/wikis/Localization.wiki?wikiVersion=GBwikiMaster&pagePath=%2FSkype%20Localization%2FProcesses%2FBug%20Process%2FBugs%2FBug%20Fixing%20and%20Closing%20Process&pageId=147)

Processes->Bug Process-> Bugs->bug Fixing and Closing Process -> Closing Bugs section allows to not regress the bugs in the loc build. 
There is no proof of loc build being fixed, but the bug has been closed as fixed-> GSX bug should be closed as fixed (Moravia is not owner of Skype/Teams bug regression) and Feedback provider informed about the fix.

In this case we can expect escalations from customers.

Suggestion: For all customer feedback bugs ported to skypelocalization.visualstudio.com/Localization : 
1. How Found field set to  Customer Feedback (Internal) or Customer Feedback (External)
2. Regressed in loc build adding screenshot of the fixed issue into the Skype bug attachments (by Pactera as final validation owner)

Estimated volume: 0-10 bug/month
Current monthly average is approx. 1.6 bug/month (1/2019-5/2019)
Comments:
Thanks, for the doc update.
FYI @Marek Brabec (MORAVIA IT A.S.+ (USD)) , @Ondrej Vrana (Moravia IT AS (USD)) , @Ondrej Buchta , @Tomas Bosak
Resolving as documentation is updated. tks

@Stafford Quaid 👀 Done, bug process updated here -https://skypelocalization.visualstudio.com/Localization/_wiki/wikis/Localization.wiki?pagePath=%2FSkype%20Localization%2FProcesses%2FBug%20Process%2FBugs%2FBug%20Fixing%20and%20Closing%20Process&pageId=147&wikiVersion=GBwikiMaster

Staff
PS We do this for Office and think it is best practice.

@Stanislav Kudelas (Moravia IT AS (USD))🧔 @Oonagh Guilfoyle @Stafford Quaid 👀 @Marek Brabec (MORAVIA IT A.S.+ (USD)) @Ondrej Vrana (Moravia IT AS (USD)) 
Current process for Pactera is that in the case of bugs where only a translation fix is being applied, regression is only needed if the translation is either majorly shorter or longer than the original translation.

However, it's not a bad suggestion to have this done for all customer feedback bugs, i'll see about working it into the existing bug process and informing Pactera.

Hi @James Breen , @Oonagh Guilfoyle , @Stafford Quaid 👀  Please confirm that Pactera should regress all customer feedback bugs ported/logged in skypelocalization and provide proof of fin in loc build.

Title: Verify user is able to view the LinkedIn icon in any Contacts in people module when enable LinkedIn feature is selected.
[Project]: Tasks being dragged through the timeline may not render under the cursor as expected
Description:
REPRO STEPS:
  1. Open a Internet Explorer
  2. Open an existing project with already existing tasks
  3. Switch to the timeline view
  4. Drag a task back and forth the left of the screen until you hover the grid


EXPECTED:

At all times the task should render under the mouse cursor


ACTUAL:

The task may render in a different position than the mouse cursor (see video)


USER BAD:

This makes our experience uncomfortable
Comments: This is because of scrolling. Not really sure how we could fix this.

Doesn't just happen in IE; this also occurred for me in Chrome. Setting to Priority 2 because this issue can happen really easily (if you're just dragging a task to the left) and is really weird plus makes placing the task in the correct place really hard.

Title: OAF: Scenario 172828 leaked Win32 Desktop PPT PIA RCWs! GC.Collect/Marshal.FinalReleaseComObject did not return, and we FAILED to kill the powerpnt.exe process!
Description:
BVT: PPT Desktop: FileIO: Create and Save Presentation [PPTX/PPT]

Scenario 172828 leaked Win32 Desktop PPT PIA RCWs!
GC.Collect/Marshal.FinalReleaseComObject did not return, and we FAILED to kill the powerpnt.exe process!
Failure waiting for final GC.Collect/Marshal.FinalReleaseComObject to return! Something is holding a reference to PowerPoint!
Before invoking Quit(), scenarios that use the OM (PIA) for Win32 Desktop Office apps must meticulously invoke Marshal.ReleaseComObject on each OM object used during the test.
Otherwise, the reference count will not drop to zero for the Runtime Callable Wrappers (RCWs) created in the .NET AppDomain, and the Process will not be able to exit!
KB 317109: http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;en-us;317109 OAUTOBUGTAG:CLS[PPT_RCW_LEAKED][172828][][][]ENDOABT (Method: MS.Internal.Test.Automation.Office.PowerPoint.PowerPointApplication.InternalQuit [G:\Build\x64\ship\ppttasklib\src\Desktop\TaskLibrary\obj\x64\powerpointapplication.cs @ 2449])

Subject: Re: FileConversionService privacy check

 

At the time this check was added, the guidance was to obey the setting / prevent the call as the main priority, with the user experience being lower priority. So, we didn't actually account for which dialog was shown...from what I recall, the generic error message was the expected behavior, and the privacy dialog wasn't available at that time. The next month/sprint was intended to polish & improve the UX, but we never went back to hook up or improve the dialog for BCS. Actually, looking back at this change, the check is at a low level, and is intended to ensure we don't accidentally make the service call. UX decisions to show the appropriate dialog should be done higher up in the stack.

 

As far as I know, Android & iOS should have the same behavior, and Win32 is not applicable since it doesn't use BCS.

Subject: RE: FileConversionService privacy check

 

Hi Shruthi,

Here is the requirement:

In case the FileConversionService call is blocked due to Privacy reasons, FileConversionService should have a way to let the callers know about this, so that the callers can show the appropriate error dialog to the user

 

Implementation:

There can be 2 approaches to this:

  1. Have the APIs GetConversionEndpointUrl/GetPdfPrintEndpointUrl return some value to indicate that the service is blocked due to privacy settings

OR

  1. Expose a new API (similar to FShowPrivacyDialog) to return the ServiceGroupDisabledReason value post querying the service status from Privacy settings, much before the actual conversion starts. Thus in case the Privacy FG  is enabled, callers would call into this API to find out if the service is disabled and accordingly show the error dialog to the user. In case the Privacy FG is disabled, callers can continue to call into FShowPrivacyDialog as is happening today.

 

From our internal discussions, (2) would be a preferred approach. Hope this helps. Please let me know in case you are looking for any more information on this.

 

Also, I would be OOF for the next few days till 11th October. Please reach out to @Ajit/@Sumeet/@Rudra/ @Pooja if you have any further questions on this.

 

Regards,

Anushma

At the time this check was added, the guidance was to obey the setting / prevent the call as the main priority, with the user experience being lower priority. So, we didn't actually account for which dialog was shown...from what I recall, the generic error message was the expected behavior, and the privacy dialog wasn't available at that time. The next month/sprint was intended to polish & improve the UX, but we never went back to hook up or improve the dialog for BCS. Actually, looking back at this change, the check is at a low level, and is intended to ensure we don't accidentally make the service call. UX decisions to show the appropriate dialog should be done higher up in the stack.

 

As far as I know, Android & iOS should have the same behavior, and Win32 is not applicable since it doesn't use BCS.

Hi Shruthi,

Here is the requirement:

In case the FileConversionService call is blocked due to Privacy reasons, FileConversionService should have a way to let the callers know about this, so that the callers can show the appropriate error dialog to the user

 

Implementation:

There can be 2 approaches to this:

  1. Have the APIs GetConversionEndpointUrl/GetPdfPrintEndpointUrl return some value to indicate that the service is blocked due to privacy settings

OR

  1. Expose a new API (similar to FShowPrivacyDialog) to return the ServiceGroupDisabledReason value post querying the service status from Privacy settings, much before the actual conversion starts. Thus in case the Privacy FG  is enabled, callers would call into this API to find out if the service is disabled and accordingly show the error dialog to the user. In case the Privacy FG is disabled, callers can continue to call into FShowPrivacyDialog as is happening today.

 

From our internal discussions, (2) would be a preferred approach. Hope this helps. Please let me know in case you are looking for any more information on this.

 

Also, I would be OOF for the next few days till 11th October. Please reach out to @Ajit/@Sumeet/@Rudra/ @Pooja if you have any further questions on this.

 

Regards,

Anushma

Deleting all three EngineCache folders seems to have worked.
Thanks for the help!

An instance of Office build has three Domino calls: EnlistBuild, MetaBuild, and ProductBuild. Each build has its own Domino engine state, stored in so-called EngineCache.

You may have wiped out the EngineCache of ProductBuild, by deleting %SRCROOT%\..\Domino\ProductBuild\EngineCache.

From your logs (CMIIW), it looks like that the EngineCache of EnlistBuild is corrupted (in particular the StringTable used by IncrementalSchedulingState).

I would try to wipe out all the EngineCache’s

%SRCROOT%\..\Domino\EnlistBuild\EngineCache
%SRCROOT%\..\Domino\MetaBuild\EngineCache
%SRCROOT%\..\Domino\ProductBuild\EngineCache

and try to rebuild.

If the error still occurs, then let us know.

Thanks,
IN

Title: macOS - press/focus state
Description:
Using Mac OneNote, version 16.19 (181010)

Unsure if there is supposed to be a press state or focus state (the darkest color state that appears) or what the intended interaction is. In the section and page panes, if the list currently does not have
a focus active the darker color appears on the current item rather than on the item you are pressing, which feels incorrect.

Example: Focus is on an item in the Section pane. I am currently on page List Item A which is the selected color. I move my mouse over List Item B and the hover color appears. I click on List Item B. At this
time, List Item A appears darker while List Item B remains the hover color, until I release the mouse and it becomes selected.

Title: [2019 Perpetual] W/X/P Win32: Help ribbon includes a What's New button that is grayed out
Description:
* Boot PowerPoint Win32 16.0.10717.20003 2019 Perpetual Volume License with Channel/Audience set to LTSC/Production.

* Blank Presentation.

* Click the Help ribbon.

 

=> Note: there is a What's New button and it is disabled.

 

Expected: no What's New button.  We don't plan to ship to new features to 2019 Perpetual Volume License customers that use the LTSC branch.  So there will never be any new features.  It is not helpful to have a button there that is always grayed out.

 

Also repros in Word and Excel.

 

Should the Help ribbon even be enabled in 2019 Perpetual?

Title: Document a "Shield QFE Playbook"
Description:
While most engineers are familiar with the general process of "investigating and fixing a bug", most engineers are unfamiliar with the process of "investigating and fixing a QFE". Furthermore, over all the QFEs that Shield handles, Shield needs to deal with a wide variety of PMs, EMs and support engineers, who each might have differing opinions and expectations about how the QFE process is supposed to work.

Documenting a "Shield QFE Playbook" would help clarify internally what Shield engineers are expected to do and to not do when investigating QFEs, as well as clarify to PMs, EMs and support engineers how Shield handles QFEs and what Shield expects of them.

Title = More text scale factor fixes
Will do.  This one requires a little more work, as my initial change only fixes menus, but it should be pretty quick.
@Travis Spomer - Can you resolve this when you check in your fix?

@Siraj Lala, I tried changing margins, etc via the live visual tree but still couldn't find a way to fix the alignment.  I'm wondering if the nesting of the text being different in the two types of buttons is preventing it.  @Travis Spomer - Is there a property that's obvious to you that should fix this?
@Steve Frank  do you have any recommendations on what we can change in our styles to fix this?
Also repros in OneNote

Those buttons are using a custom Outlook style, so you should be able to fully customize them however you want.  Text scale factor != 100% is not supported by the built-in styles, but I think you should be able to achieve what you want regardless.

It turns out the vertical alignment is actually off even for normal 100% scaling.  In this case the SplitButton text is lower by a couple of pixels instead of higher (at least on my Surface Book.  The other screenshot is from a devbox.)

@Travis Spomer - When using a TextScaleFactor > 100%, the text labels in Buttons and SplitButtons in the same Ribbon don't align vertically.  Any idea if this can be fixed?  See the previous pic from earlier today to see the result.  The visual tree shows an extra Border inside the Button.
@Steve Frank   -I'd like to fix this if we can. It's very ugly. Not aligning the icons or not aligning today I could probably live with, but the text as well is pretty bad.
@Kate Everitt Do we care about this misalignment in the ribbon?  There is a problem with the alignment of dropdown buttons in the ribbon itself.  This is at 225%:

Unlocalized issue on O365 Admin Center Preview UI. Translation are in Fabric since Oct. 2018 but not in build yet.

Issue repro on multiple languages, zh-CN, ru-RU, suppose this will repro on all languages. Screenshot attached.

The bug is valid. I guess it's an underlying technical issue so this would concern several languages. As this comes from a preview version, we don't need to fix anything in older products. It's not a consistency issue. No term in TS is affected. The priority is correct.

The untranslated strings in question are:
  1.  Search users or groups (found translated in Chicago, ResID 0;"String Table"\0;"Strings"\0;"Search.SearchPlaceholder")
  2. Add card (found several occurrences in Chicago, all of them translated)
  3. Essentials (found two occurrences in Chicago, both translated)
  4. Preview on (found translated in Chicago, ResID 0;"String Table"\0;"Strings"\0;"Header.PreviewOn")

Please note that because of the DTT/DTF process from Microsoft, we could not change the translations without MS approval in OMain tenant. Therefore, if located string is in OMain, please provide the strings and translations in the comment first. Do not fix such strings in Fabric. Thank you!

Instructions for moderators (ver: 1.3)

 

STEPS FOR BUG EVALUATION

Please follow steps below to evaluate the bug:

 

1. If the feedback/issue in Description fields is not in English, please provide the translation under “Discussion” field

2. Decide if the feedback is valid:

 

2.1. If the feedback is not justified, change the state to “Resolved”, select “Not Repro” in the field “Resolved Reason” and provide the explanation in the “Discussion” field. Make sure to assign the bug back to “OISGMajordomo” alias.

 

2.2. If the bug is justified and the issue described can be located:

a. Choose “Ling” tab and fill in required fields:

• Linguistic impact

• DQF Error Type

• DQF Specific Error

• Root cause

• Additional comment (if necessary)

b. Decide if it is a world readiness issue (with high probability that the issue will apply for other languages as well). If yes, please provide a detailed explanation in a “Discussion” field and add new tag “xLanguage_candidate”

c. Decide if the issue is worth fixing in an already released products (Office 2016 + Office 2013) by using SE_S1 ; SE_S2 ; SE_S3 or SE_S4 tag. This only applies to issues, which contain tag SharePoint or where Release group equals Desktop (Windows). Please find more information about this process on the following site (focus on section B. NEW BUGS):

https://portal.moravia.com/prj/officegroup/Linguistics/ModeratorSection/Moderator%20Kit%20Mainstream/Instructions%20for%20backporting.aspx

d. Decide if bug affects an approved term in Term Studio and if GTC is required.

  1. If there is no approved term in Term Studio (the concept does not exist), tag the VSTS item with tag “TS_SourceTerm_Candidate”
  2. If GTC is required, file a request to the GTC list
  3. If source or targets does not have any Office products in P/T, tag the VSTS item with tag “TS_AddSourcePT_Candidate” or “AddTargetPT_Candidate”

    e. Decide if this is a consistency issue and evaluate how many occurrences need to be changed.

    f. Assess whether the “priority” is accurate by referring to the bug priority classification

     

    2.3 If the feedback is justified but the issue mentioned in the feedback no longer exists in files, describe the situation under the “Discussion” field, and assign bug to “VT_Moravia” for further validation.

     

    3. If you have doubts regarding the validity of the bug or need more information, please assign the bug back to “OISG Majordomo” alias and request more details under the “Discussion” field.

    4. If you need to review occurrences before deciding and you are unable to access Fabric or a file, you may assign the bug to VT_Moravia and ask the team to locate the occurrences for you. (Please note in case of UA (Articles), an Internet search can provide additional content – no Resource IDs are needed). Make sure to describe what steps have been taken so far under the “Discussion” field.

     

    STEPS FOR BUG RESOLUTION

Resolving UI bug

 

If the language moderator is 100% sure where to locate the string, then s/he implements the fix directly in LEAF FOR THE SPECIFIC PRODUCT/PROJECT only.

 

If you are unsure reach out to the LSX PM in Microsoft. Do not forget to always provide ResID and File Name under the “Discussion” field. Change the state to “Resolved” and assign the bug to VT_Moravia for regression. If language moderators are not 100% sure about the implementation results, they keep the bug as “Active”, provide the resolution in the “Discussion” field, and assign the bug to VT_Moravia, who will implement the fix instead.

Resolving UA bug

 

Language moderator adds the evaluation results in the “Discussion” field, changes the path to GSX/Modern Assistance/INTL Production/, as well as the appropriate sub-node, for example, IW_Articles, Templates, Video etc, and assigns the bug to VT_Moravia for implementation.

 

In any case (for both UI and UA bugs), the language moderator should simultaneously add/update Term Studio entries as necessary.

 

For more details on global term change, please refer to the GTC process:

 

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/OISGPortal/linguistic/Moderator%20Kit/Global%20Term%20Change%20(GTC).aspx

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/OISGPortal/linguistic/_layouts/15/start.aspx#/Moderator%20Kit/Term%20change%20management%20in%20TS.aspx

Title: Ring:2 App:Word Mode:View - Product Validation Pass: Manual Test Pass Status
Description:
This is the bug that we should open every time we start a new Product Validation Pass in a Ring.
Important things to remember:
  1. Use THIS template to log the Product Validation Pass status
  2. Update the title to say which Ring was the test pass done on (Ring 1 or 2 etc) , App (Word, Excel, OneNote or PowerPoint) and Mode (View, Edit)
  3. Fill the Opened Build with the right build# 
  4. Always ensure that the status of the Product Validation Pass is updated (As shown below)
The different status are:
To show that the pass has started please change the following values:
State : Active and Sub-Status : In Progress

To show that the pass is completed and found NO ship blocking bugs
State: Closed and Reason (filled by default) : Fixed

To show that the pass has completed and found SOME ship blocking bugs
State: Resolved and Sub Status : Blocked

Title: Teams Win32: de-DE: Missing translation for Manage team App descriptions
Description:
Action Performed: 
1. Click on "Teams" 
2. Click on three dots on the left hand side of a team of your choice (More options) 
3. Click on "Manage team" 
4. Click on "Apps" Expected Results: Description for "Forms" and "Praise" is not translated. Forms - Einfach Umfragen, Quiz und Abstimmungen erstellen Praise - Loben Sie Ihre Kollegen 

Actual Results: Description for "Forms" and "Praise" is not translated Forms - Easily create surveys, quizzes and polls Praise - Send praise to people 
Current String: Forms - Easily create surveys, quizzes and polls Praise - Send praise to people 
Recommended String: Forms - Einfach Umfragen, Quiz und Abstimmungen erstellen Praise - Loben Sie Ihre Kollegen 
English Translation: Forms - Easily create surveys, quizzes and polls Praise - Send praise to people 

Platform Tested: Teams Win32 
Multi Country Report: No
Tags: Applause; GIG; Language Quality; Software Validation; Teams Win32
Comments: @Natasha Pererezova  The issue is too old and it is a little hard to find it, I can only find a similar bug for Forms. Bug 8491

@Stafford Quaid 👀 it's not a problem of Praise and Forms (as well as other apps).  It's a way how applications are loaded to the store now.  Currently, only 1 language can be uploaded.  It's a limitation (for some apps a workaround was implemented, but only for necessary minimum).  Now product team is implementing a global fix.  This problem will be resolved soon, since it's a high priority.
@Zhen Zhen (Pactera Technologies) I remember, we already had bugs about Forms and wiki long ago.  If you can easily find them, please, can you link it?
@Zhen Zhen (Pactera Technologies) @Natasha Pererezova can we link to the 2 external bugs if such a bugs exist? Is anyone following up with the Praise & forms teams to ensure these get localised?
Resolve as external string.
Right, this is external.
These strings come from the extensions, and they are not from Teams, can we resolve them as external? @Natasha Pererezova
Germany- Teams Win32

WordBot Task:OCEAddImpactedAppWord / Contact:jeffcr / Details: Wiki

Ravi recently moved this scenario from our Comps_DebugFailing group to Comps_DebugPassing. He did this because after many reruns, the test was showing very high reliability. After it was turned on, it started failing in tenantword. There might be a regression here, but it's hard to say. Is this test sensitive to the tests that run before it?

Here's the scenario history. We ran the test in debug once per week for a periodic signal of its pass rate. It had been passing for a long time until we added it back to the Comps_DebugFailing IBG. Then it started failing in tenantword, but not devmain. Why doesn't it fail in devmain? It's possible there's a very recent tenantword regression.

Title: Roll out Data Protection BLOB storage changes
[IR5344661] SOS: ASG:Change in Fabric access policy affected large number of user accounts
Description:
###Assigned to: v-rosace@microsoft.com
###Tags: TAT;Software
@@@p1

From: Office Engineering Labs Ticketing
Sent: Monday, April 16, 2018 11:14 PM
To: Robin Sacek (Moravia IT)
Subject: RE: [IR5344661] SOS: ASG:Change in Fabric access policy affected large number of user accounts

Comment added to ticket
A comment has been added to the following ticket. The details are listed below.
[IR5344661]
SOS: ASG:Change in Fabric access policy affected large number of user accounts
Created by v-rosace
Created on Monday, April 16, 2018 at 8:47:42 AM
Priority 1
Incident Request for ORFSUP has been created:
Description: Hello, apparently there has been a change in Fabric access policy recently as many users are reporting that Fabric login requires parents' permission for MS accounts where age of user is set under 18 years. Those users are not able to access Fabric
without a workaround and won't be able to access at all after April 30th (see attached screenshot).
Microsoft accounts are mostly dummy profiles with no real birth dates assigned so the restriction does not make much sense here.
We tried to change birth dates for some but apparently MS policy does not allow this now. If we log into each profile and change year of birth, it doesn't get saved to the profile and account still carries the original birth date. It looks like we would have
to create hundreds of new accounts instead which is obviously a lot of manual work and costs in managed services.
Ask: Is it possible to lift the age restriction on Fabric level so we do not need to create the new MS accounts for your supply chain in localization? It can cause a service downtime.
Service Affected: Office Resource Fabric
Team Impacted: Office
Severity: 1
Symptom: Lost or incorrect permissions
Owning Team: Office Sup
Region: Europe
Origin: Moravia
Environment: Live (PROD)
Comments
Greetings Robin,
The issue that you are running into is an issue with Windows Live, and not Fabric. Fabric has no way to circumvent age restrictions that are controlled by Windows Live - as such this is external to us.
We have created a VSO bug 2273915 to track this issue and it is assigned to Daniel Rim.
Currently the work-around for this would be within the Windows Live system. For example, do you have a parent account associated, or that could be associated to all of your dummy accounts that do not have their birthdate set that could then approve their access,
and subsequently allow for a birthdate update on the profile?
If so, you could possibly then update the birthdates of all of your user accounts to make them valid, though to do so manually could take some time.
Alternatively, you could possibly reach out to the Windows Live team itself, and see if they were able to change your Windows Live data on the back end.
This Ticket is being resolved as this is not a problem that Fabric Support can do anything about.
v-cacoll
4/16/2018 2:12 PM
Ticket updated without a comment. Actions performed:
Assigning to v-cacoll
v-cacoll
4/16/2018 10:33 AM
Attachments: Fabric_access.png
Regards
The
Lab

The rest actually look like FPs to me:
- the LV one was updated during TCR process so not sure why it was raised as a flag as there was no change on source or TRAP, but SAD got updated after the TCR got Crew Approved on Friday 20th and TRC was then implemented on Tuesday 24th. Which is fine from my point of view.
- the UKR strings are a bit suspicious, their SAD was updated after unfreeze but as they are marked Sensitive, I'm checking internally what is going on as I don't see there any pending action.

Please let me know in case there are any additional details needed.

Thank you,
Petr V.
@Petr Vojta (Moravia IT) is looking into this now.

@Robin Sacek i am still seeing some WIMS warnings on Outlook Desktop strings. Are you still working through the build up? See attached of the ones i have recieved since Friday. I am double checking as its unusual for me to see so many Outlook warnings and i would have expected Moravia to have caught up on the backlog by now. 
FYI.. @Ger Harrington @Audrey Barry

Issues resolved internally by creating new accounts. There are still minor numbers of accounts with access issues, but we can handle those on the fly. No major delays caused by access issues since yesterday. FYI @Audrey Barry

@Audrey Barry @Zoltan Szanto (Moravia IT AS (EUR)) @Prokop Vlasin (Moravia IT) in short, many linguists cannot log in to Fabric so their work is blocked due to policy change for Microsoft account (global change). We have a workaround and need to create new Fabric accounts. As it has caused a lot of information exchange and between supply chain and Moravia, we might have some smaller delays in localization. We are supplying teams with new accounts as soon as we can.

Title: [Android] Device orientation change switches email being viewed when app is first launched from widget
Description:
When the application is launched by tapping an email within the Android widget, the app appears to "hold" that email in the background when the user views other messages. The original message reappears whenever there is an orientation change from landscape back to portrait. When this occurs, the "held" email appears back on the screen in place of the current email the user is viewing.

(This explanation is probably confusing as hell – just watch the video and you'll see what I mean)



Original Ticket Number: AC-12939

Original Ticket Type: Bug

Sprints:
Sprint 72
Sprint 73

Reporter: David Weiler

Original Components:
Android
Android - Mail
ReproSteps:
1. Set up the Outlook mail widget on your Home screen.
2. Ensure the Outlook app is totally closed out. Open an email from the Outlook widget.
3. Press back, and find another email. Open the other email.
4. Flip the device from portrait mode to landscape, wait about 5 seconds (for some reason you need to wait and can't flip back immediately), then flip it back to portrait mode. Poof! The first email you opened will magically re-appear!
ExpectedOutcome: We expect the email that is currently being viewed to stay on the screen.

Title: First Run: lock to region
Description:
Approved plan: do the same thing for the first run experience that we do for dialogs: constrain the first run UI to the topmost/leftmost monitor.  The UI should lay out as if only that monitor were available, so using that monitor's dimensions to determine what to show, and showing the left and right paddles on that monitor.  The other monitors should only show the background color, which is normally the app color, but can also be a light grey color when the window is very small.

First run is a little lower priority since it's something you only see once, and you can only see it in the bad state if you manually put the app into the bad state.
Comments:
Changelist: 16226993

OfficeVSO:2083747 - First Run: lock to region

OfficeVSO:2110313 - Merchandizing Page: lock to region

Explain Defect: The first run and merchandizing page features need DisplayRegion tailoring.

Explain Fix: Use the new SingleDisplayRegionPanel control.

Notes: Only affects the first run and merchandizing page ("buy a subscription!" UI) features.

PR Tester: travis

Reviewer: kbrice

Codeflow ID: 199785

Trigger overrides: osubmitdepot; CXE approved.

[CodeFlowLink]
Id = 199785
Url = http://codeflow/extensions/launcher.html?server=https:%2f%2foffice.visualstudio.com%2fdefaultcollection&projectId=35d89fa2-df50-4442-9cb8-cc8679898172&reviewId=199785&projectshortname=OE
Title = First Run and Merchandizing WCOS tailoring

Greg proposes that this is a fairly low priority, as it's not the default situation, and you only see first-run once—effectively, if the user gets into this, it's by their own choice, and they can easily get out of it, and they'll never see it again.  So while it looks bad, we can probably punt it back a bit in the schedule.  I think that logic makes sense.

Title: OAF: FlexUI RPC call never returned: FSGallery.FireEvent_OnDroppingCommand -> SetFieldValue FlexUI Data Source Proxy method, 'SetFieldValue', never returned
Description:
Insert Bibliography - Single Source

Error: Unhandled exception in required test method. FlexUI RPC call never returned: FSGallery.FireEvent_OnDroppingCommand -> SetFieldValue
FlexUI Data Source Proxy method, 'SetFieldValue', never returned control to caller, 'FSGallery.FireEvent_OnDroppingCommand'.
This may be expected for certain scenarios where the FlexUI Data Source proxy does not send an RPC response until, for example, modal UI is dismissed.
We are using a 5-minute timeout to allow enough time to avoid most of those cases.  If you find that you need more than that timeout to accomplish
your UI automation scenario, you should wrap the FlexUI Data Source proxy invocation in a try/catch(UtilitiesTimeoutException) block to avoid failing on the blocking RPC request.

Title: InputDelayTraceCallstacks timing out while sqlizing data from 5/18 and 5/22
Description:
From: Fritz Stugren
Sent: Monday, June 4, 2018 10:59 AM
To: David Jade <djade@microsoft.com>; SQLizer Discussion <sqlizerDisc@microsoft.com>
Subject: RE: Timed out while Sqlizing to Azure SQL
Hi David,
Your activity is timing out in the post-download step that creates the index too.
Optimizing index creation is beyond the scope of the SQLizer DL, but we try to provide a few tips in the wiki. SQL Index creation is a very I/O intensive operation and requires careful tuning. Having the rows clustered in the same order and by the same columns in cosmos and in SQL is just one thing that we noticed (at the time we were investing more in SQL downloads) would improve performance, but it does not guarantee that things would go smoother.
One thing you could try is changing the clustered index to a non-clustered one.

From: David Jade
Sent: Monday, June 4, 2018 9:25 AM
To: SQLizer Discussion <sqlizerDisc@microsoft.com>
Subject: Timed out while Sqlizing to Azure SQL

I’ve been getting this error on two dates of the streamset I’ve been trying to Sqlize:
Microsoft.Xbox.SQLizer.Common.Utilities.SQLizerException: Sql Error Number: -2. Execution Time: 01:00:04. SQL operation timed out. Look for blocking sessions that may have prevented the operation from completing. Any external schema stability locks (Sch-S) or schema modification locks (Sch-M) will cause SQLizer to time out while performing partition switch or table switch.

I’m using the shared agent. I saw in another thread some comments about issues with clustered indexes using uniqueidentifier columns, so I tried removing the uniqueidentifier from the clustered index (it was the 4th column in the index as it was), and also tried cranking up my Azure SQL to the highest number of DTUs it allows. There was no other activity on this database at the time.

The streamset is CLUSTERED BY and SORTED BY a superset of the clustered index:

Cosmos script:
CLUSTERED BY AnalyzedProcessName, LastOfficeFrame, WaitType, TraceId, DeviceId
SORTED BY AnalyzedProcessName, LastOfficeFrame, WaitType, TraceId, DeviceId

Sqlizer manifest:
              <index name="CIX_InputDelayTraceCallstacks" type="Clustered">
                <column name="AnalyzedProcessName" order="1"/>
                <column name="LastOfficeFrame" order="2"/>
                <column name="WaitType" order="3"/>
              </index>
Those columns strings, sqlized types of nvarchar(20), varchar(500), and nvarchar(20), respectively.

Title: Acronyms endpoint should be a separate endpoint and not in CheckAuth
Description:
Talked with Enrico about this.
Editor response was extended back in 2017 to support reading responses but overall this haven't caught up apart from Acronyms (other features such as Todo and Keypoints are using their own separate endpoints).
In the future, CheckAuth will be used to surface user-tailored critiques and we would like to avoid having additional COGS of calling into Acronyms service as well in this endpoint.

Please also open work items to cover monitoring and incidents of this new endpoint.
Comments: Tracked under #3532097

Title: [Outlook] Create editorial calendar for Outlook.com help pane cards
Description: Create schedule to rotate featured help cards per season -- e.g. how to prepare for traveling before holidays, etc.

Title: Logging improvements to help with Support
Description:
JonasG has a number of logging improvement suggestions to help with cases.
  • Don't require Outlook restart when enabling advanced logging (shouldn't need to anymore)
  • Allow "recovery" to push down logging provider changes
  • Default logging: decrease the amount of RPC logs - we haven't had an RPC problem in a long time

Title: Update perf markers in RenderedImageEditOperation.cs
Comments:
Changelist: 19516516

OfficeVSO:3233545 - Update perf markers in RenderedImageEditOperation.cs

Explain Fix: Issue: Perf markers are not correct for our drawing type pipeline. This was deliberately checked in correctly since we couldn't use the correct perf markers initially since we needed CL 18923691 to FI into tenantwac.

Fix: Updating perf markers with the correct ones.

Reviewer: qijinz;shwe;wwcrbot;mikkoma

BB Job IDs: 369149974

Codeflow ID: 710865

CloudBuild ID: 473d8c6c-1cb9-0ac6-a22a-98b2e43443d5

Change the following:
PerfMarker.perfWacPictureStyleStart to PerfMarker.perfWacSmartArtEditStart
PerfMarker.perfWacPictureStyleEnd to PerfMarker.perfWacSmartArtEditEnd

We couldn't use the correct perf markers because ... #459 change 18722165 edit on 2019/03/14 13:11:48 by REDMOND\boalbe@boalbe_tword (text) 'OfficeVSO:3218254 - Enable resi' hasn't RI'ed into tenant wac yet.

PerfMarker.perfWacPictureStyleStart to PerfMarker.perfWacDrawingEditStart
PerfMarker.perfWacPictureStyleEnd to PerfMarker.perfWacDrawingEditEnd

Title: Service should convert WipeRequested errors to Disconnects
Description:
If the client is not connected, client would be sending Initialize or BeginSync to the server. Server's PolicyEvaluator.IsRemoteWipeRequired would see that
it is not a ping or notify account wipe, then it will send the RemoveWipe error, this error comes to the client before client got a ack for connection. Client does not know what to do with this error as the http socket connection is not even completed yet,
so the error gets ignored. So server first needs to ack the connection and then send the errors.
private static bool ShouldSkipPolicyCheck(SocketRequest request)
{
// skip if the request is coming from the probes, whose device type contain the Probe string.
// skip if the request is coming from the automation, whose device type contain the Automation string.
// skip if the client doesn't say it supports policy enforcement
// The NotifyAccountWipe command will be sent in response to a WipeRequestedError, so
// we want to process it regardless of the current WipeRequested state.
return
(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(request.DeviceType) &&
(request.DeviceType.Contains(Constants.SocketProbeDeviceType) || request.DeviceType.Contains(Constants.SocketAutomationDeviceType))) ||
request.CommandId == OutlookServiceNamespaceCommands.Initialize ||
request.CommandId == OutlookServiceNamespaceCommands.Ping ||
request.CommandId == OutlookServiceNamespaceCommands.NotifyAccountWipe ||
!request.ClientSupportsPolicyEnforcement();
}
public bool IsRemoteWipeRequired(SocketRequest request)
{
// Skip remote wipe checks for commands that should be excluded, as well as probes and automation.
if (request.CommandId == OutlookServiceNamespaceCommands.Ping ||
request.CommandId == OutlookServiceNamespaceCommands.NotifyAccountWipe ||
string.IsNullOrEmpty(request.DeviceType) ||
request.DeviceType.Contains(Constants.SocketProbeDeviceType) ||
request.DeviceType.Contains(Constants.SocketAutomationDeviceType))
{
return false;
}

Comments:
Right. I've checked in the change described above because it works unconditionally for both old and new clients, and fixes the "getting stuck" problem we could see with old clients. But it's more consistent with other
policy errors to switch to a disconnect for remote wipe, conditioned based on client build number, and I've opened a task to track doing that.

We need to send this per client version. As older clients did not expect the remote wipe as disconnect.
Sent from
Outlook Mobile

I made a local change to have the server send SocketResponse.MessageType = Disconnect rather than Error when sending back the WipeRequested SocketStatusCode. On builds without your recent change, Umut - I'm testing with
Universal build 16004.0.10730.2003 - this seems to have made things worse.
Previously, when WipeRequested was sent as an Error, the client was able to handle it successfully at least when it was already connected. It was only a problem when trying to connect.
Now when I'm sending it as a Disconnect, the client gets stuck in a BeginSync or Initialize loop whether it's connected or not when the remote wipe is initiated.
Instead then, I'm keeping the MessageType as Error for now, but am excluding Initialize from RemoteWipe enforcement. This should be fine since it doesn't return mail content. So if the client is disconnected when RemoteWipe
happens, it's able to establish a socket with Initialize, and then gets RemoteWipe on the next command. I've confirmed RemoteWipe is handled successfully now in both the connected and disconnected cases, for the older build mentioned above and this morning's
tenant build which I believe has the recent client changes around this.

How To Repro This Failure

  • bb local -m client:<machine> -m server:<machine> -f debug -to 403710 -config wac-ap-win10s -build client:16.0.10214.10000 -build server:16.0.10214.10000
  • bb run -to wac-ap-win10s:403710 -f debug -vm -hftid 2758488 -fc -c 16.0.10214.10000
  • bb investigate -b pretest -vm -to wac-ap-win10s:403710 -f Debug -fc -c 16.0.10214.10000
