Comments: This is a known issue, it caused by CL#16925856 from tenantwac has RIed to Devmain 16.0.10212.10000, and caused our series of test cases timeout and failed. WAC team had backed out the bad change by CL16954401. So closed this OAF bug.

Scenario Hermes WebDriver - MergeListOfDifferentLevel is a sample failure from this bucket, that caused this bug to be opened.

- Have e.g. a session of Excel open

- Acquire Stock Connector from AppSource

Title: Change manageability addon to block service
Description: Change manageability addon to block service until process end.
Comments:
Changelist: 19529059

OfficeVSO:3538780 - Change manageability addon to block service

Explain Defect: 1.When trigger ODT, OfficeSvcMgr service will be blocked instead of creating a new process.

2.ODT will be download to C:\\Program Files\\Common Files\\microsoft shared\\OfficeSvcMgr instead of %temp%

3.When trigger ODT, the default action is figure.

4.When download ODT, program will check if ODT is the latest version, if it is the latest version, it will not download ODT again(It has not been finished, once we have a Nimbus API to tell us the latest ODT version, I will implement the GetLatestODTVersion)

Explain Fix: 1. When trigger ODT, OfficeSvcMgr service will be blocked instead of creating a new process.

2. ODT will be download to C:\\Program Files\\Common Files\\microsoft shared\\OfficeSvcMgr instead of %temp%

3. When trigger ODT, the default action is figure.

4. When download ODT, program will check if ODT is the latest version, if it is the latest version, it will not download ODT again(It has not been finished, once we have a Nimbus API to tell us the latest ODT version, I will implement the GetLatestODTVersion)

Title: Privacy Cleanup: tag b1q4i requires cleaning up
Description:
Tag b1q4i might contain a PII leak.
Please remove leak at your earliest.

Leak sample: View sample
Detected Session ID's: ["00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000","507abc44-95b1-4bfe-ba36-1b300fc7df48","f92890cb-c947-4bc3-abea-596796b419cf","fcf4c924-e4e1-4a33-8dac-7dcbdbf884e7","db3232a0-cc35-459c-9e7d-305860006a3d"]

Personal identifiable information is any information relating to an identifiable person, this might include URL's, font names or data typed by the user.

Consider the following option for a resolution:
1. Remove the entire log
2. Remove a faulty parameter. Note that URLs are anyhow hashed (redacted) by default so by removing a URL that failed to be redacted you don't lose telemetry capabilities.
3. Wrap the parameter with a PII scrubbing function. This is more likely to succeed since we know the length of the string thus less impacted by spaces in the URL. It will preserve the hash from #3
4. Custom fix
5. If you don't see a leak anymore resolve as Not Reproducible
6. If you think it is a false positive resolve as By Design. Consider adding the tag or a know pattern to the exclusion . Please contact Haim Sawdayee (hasawday) or Oren Shmuely (orensh)...

For privacy related questions please contact WAC Privacy

Title: After loading-from-cache and re-inserting a Custom Functions add-in, execution stops working
Description:
ServerEvents are missing in the SetCell response payload.
May not repro after Yutao's fix to to VSO#2302641 (Custom Functions for WAC - We should only create the hidden IFRAME on first execution). Need to verify.
Comments:
Changelist: 17008324

OfficeVSO:2248234 - Custom Functions for WAC - not executing after installing from cache (dev-catalog)

OfficeVSO:2309675 - After loading-from-cache and re-inserting a Custom Functions add-in, execution stops working

Explain Defect: Steps:

1. Open a workbook on WAC and install a Custom Functions add-in from dev-catalog.

2. Close the workbook and open another workbook

3. Make sure the registration of the previously installed function is still working (auto-complete in the cell should work as expected)

4. Try to execute the function

Expected:

The function should be executed and the result should show up.

Actual:

Nothing happens. It shows "#GETTING_DATA".

Root Cause:

The on-demand creation of hidden OsfControl/IFrame needs the manifest. The code in OsfWeb first checks to see if the manifest is already in the in-memory cache (which is missing). If not, it will try to download it, which is not possible at this particular time because it doesn't have the right context to initiate a manifest downloading.

Note:

This seems to be an issue only for the add-ins installed from dev-catalog. For add-ins from file-upload and other QuickCheck enabled add-ins, the QuickCheck/AutoInstall code will kick-in and try to install the add-in, which will run into the same code path as the initial installation.

Explain Fix: As I was not able to find any existing ways to simulate the installation process to re-download the manifest, it seems the only solution would be storing the manifest into localStorage during the initial installation and restore it into the in-memory cache for OsfWeb. This is basically what the QuickCheck/AutoInstall for file-upload code does today.

Notes: • Normal validation steps:

1) RunAll: PASSED

2) RunJS: PASSED

3) Manual test Win32 devcatalog/file-share RichApiAgave V1/V2 & Uiless V1/V2: PASSED

4) Manual test WAC devcatalog/fileu-pload RichApiAgave V2 & Uiless V2: PASSED

5) BB: PASSED with only unrelated failures

• Scenario validation: PASSED

1) Install the UI-less V2 add-in from devcatalog and ensure registration/execution work as expected;

2) Refresh the browser or create/open another workbook;

3) Make sure the Custom Functions registration/execution still work as expected;

4) There is a known issue that existing formulas in the worksheet will become "#NAME?" but a force recalc (CTRL+SHIFT+ALT+F9) will bring them back to normal.

FYI,

I started a CR to fix the issue reported by Robert in attached mail.

The reason for issue is we have activity generator that generates activities every 30sec. If during that 30sec window, An author made both comment and comment reply, then because we are using same person object, roles from one activity
is getting used for other activities. I made changes in "GetPeopleInfoDictionary" to always return copy of the People dictionary instead of returning same dictionary(objects) every time.

Title: Accessibility: iOS: MAS 1.3.4 : Unable to take photo while attaching photo in Compose pane in Landscape Mode.
ReproSteps:
1. Launch Outlook dev application and login with valid credentials.
  2. Navigate to the 'Compose' button and select it.
  3. In the 'Compose' window, navigate to the 'Take Photo' button and activate it.
  4. Try to click and attach the photo in landscape mode.
ExpectedOutcome: The 'Take Photo' or 'Back' buttons or other camera options should be available while clicking a picture in Landscape mode.
ActualOutcome:
The 'Take Photo' or 'Back' buttons and other camera options are missing while clicking a picture in Landscape mode. Unable to go back to the Compose pane from the 'Take Photo' window.

Note:
After switching from 'landscape' to portrait mode, the buttons remain missing in portrait mode also.

User Impact:
Users with dexterity impairments, who have a mounted device will not be able to click any pictures to attach in the mail in landscape mode and will be struck in the Take photo window.

MAS Link : MAS 1.3.4 - Orientation ***
Tags: A11yHighImpact; A11yMAS; A11yRT; A11yWCAG2.1; Accessibility; MAS1.3.4; Sev2; Wipro
Comments:
@Mitali Jain Yes, verified the issue and it is fixed and working fine for me in the current build. Hence closing the bug.

Verified Environment:
iOS Version: 12.3.1
Outlook dev Version : 3.33.0 711.2535022.dev.iphone
@Shreyosi Mukherjee (Wipro Ltd.) @Manish Rawat I am unable to repro this. Working for me.

@Manish Rawat @Mitali Jain This is an accessibility bug as per the WCAG2.1 MAS guidelines and this does not require VO to be turned on. As per the MAS, all the contents which is accessible in portrait mode should also be accessible in landscape mode(MAS 1.3.4 - Orientation). So here in the bug, 'Take Photo' buttons and other required camera options are not appearing in landscape mode( as visible in the attached screenshot).

@Mitali Jain I am not able to repro this issue. Tried with and without voiceover. Is voiceover actually required to repro this, it is not very clear from description and steps. Could you try to repro it at your end. Feel free to re-assign it back to me.
@Manish Rawat can you please take a look at this? cc: @Rahul Bhuptani
@Mitali Jain this looks like a functional issue rather than an accessibility one. Can you see if this bug repros for you on iOS and get someone on the Lens team to take a look? Thanks!

Title: arm64e: Update Dropbox SDK to Include arm64e Slice for iOS
Description:
Xcode 10.1 adds arm64e as a supported architecture for iOS devices. This architecture introduces a feature called pointer authentication, which cryptographically verifies pointer integrity at runtime.

Apple's implementation of this feature signs vtable pointers using a hash of the mangled name. The pointer is verified at each call site. The mangled name, however, differs in Objective-C++ with ARC vs. Objective-C++ without ARC and/or C++. If pointer authentication fails, and it will for mixed code, the pointer is transformed to an illegal address and the process crashes when the pointer is dereferenced.

In order to start investigating the effects of arm64e on our products (which will become a mandatory architecture at some point), we need external libraries to provide an arm64e slice as soon as possible.

Please update the external Dropbox SDK with an arm64e slice (which requires compilation with Xcode 10.1).
Comments: Fixed by removing Dropbox SDK. We don't need it anymore. Haven't needed in a while.
Associated with change #18119011. Updated on behalf of smultani by Apex VSO client.

Title: iOS_Word: Investigate erratic cursor movement using hardware keyboard selection keys
Description:
If the cursor is active in some part of a document, then on scrolling down with the finger, tapping somewhere else, and pressing the OPTION+SHIFT+arrow key to select words, the screen jumps to another part of the document
The grippy and selection are at different places on the screen. The grippy is initially drawn at the same place on the screen as the selection, but the underlying text was getting scrolled after. During debugging it is found that ASInternalScrollView setContentOffset is called by the OS after grippy is drawn in the error cases. This does not happen for the character selections which is done by SHIFT+Arrow keys. The reason is not clear for this.

Adding iOS Hardware keyboard mapping for Word and Paragraph selections similar to line and char selections to fix customer experience while we look at a long term solution.
Comments: Have resolved the reported issue by working around using overriding the keyboard mapping. This work item was to investigate why it was happening. Resolving it as postponed for now as we have other priority items preventing from getting to it.

Title: Word Desktop: Word Document Crashing on Save ("Office.Word.FileSave.ActCmdGosubSaveAs ")
Description:
This work item has been linked to an OCV Issue. Links to the OCV Issue can be found in the 'All Links' tab of this work item.

Reported Build: 16.0.9330.2087

OCV Feedback Links:
  • https://ocv.azurewebsites.net/#/item/fdcl_v4_a240327a0cd05f2cb054bb6f30bc92fd/
  • https://ocv.azurewebsites.net/#/item/fdcl_v4_ddaf2fb1b4cc5b57ab5b75d18c562cdc/
Comments: WordBot Task:OCEAddImpactedAppWord / Contact:jeffcr / Details: Wiki

I'm unsure how the first OCV feedback link is related to the second OCV feedback link.

For the first link, I see no recent OCV feedback available for the supplied email address. Looking in Kusto for crashes with the provided Client_Id gives me nothing at all. Looking at device drill for the provided device id also gives me nothing related to winword.exe. And, as Greg already mentioned, the Watson links are crashing in oleacc.dll component across many different executables. Taking a look at the ones I found for Word and Excel, there were no cabs collected and hits were very low. So, in all, there isn't much actionable to leverage here.

For the second like, I also see no data in Kusto related to crashes with the provided Client_Id. Device drill has nothing at all for the device id. And the two failures we see in the save activity are "ICE" failures. We are aborting the saves because the document is not dirty.

So, for both OCV cases (which I'm not convinced are related at all), there is nothing actionable with respect to Word.

I don't see any relevant Watson crashes in the second OCV link.  The first OCV link seems to be crashing in oleacc.dll, as in https://watson/Failure?FailureSearchText=4770ffa9-7aad-e56d-e2b1-02d71486c893.

Title: IA service: Ryan suggests to use 50% transparency for converted shape from highlighter
Description:
Highlighter strokes use min-blend to render you can see the shapes under it.
After converting to shape, it uses fallback color and it is opaque so it will cover the shapes under it.
So Ryan suggests to use 50% transparency color for shapes converted from highlighter.

Title: Keep getting message: The service is too busy to complete request
Description: This work item has been linked to an OCV Issue. Links to the OCV Issue can be found in the 'All Links' tab of this work item.
Comments: I made my check-in to move to the FssHttpB protocol for these requests.  We'll need to turn it on one environment at a time, depending on how things look like in FF.
Lightning Bug notification sent for 9/22/2019
@Alexandre Grigorovitch I have a code review out to help with this.  I took the bug back.  Thanks for your help investigating yesterday.
It is actually a strange error coming from Cobalt (LocalCobalt). Happens only with Wacii few times a day per-DC. Investigating.
@Alexandre Grigorovitch also this is a pretty old session from 8/20 so the logs won't be around for long.

@Dave Gray  - Actually, I was wrong.  The error I fixed was that the document couldn't be coauthored (when it was a single user scenario).  This is a different issue.  Looking at the logs the GetCells was retrying for more than 3 minutes, so rather than leave the user with SSR or a spinner, we timed out the session!

Looking at the logs, the user start by getting redirecting from PP3 to PP4.  That seems inconsequential to the root problem.  Once in PP4, they try to connect to the backend and get told that BackupConsidersSelfPrimary.  So they try to connect to the backup and perform a failover... this fails with QuotaExceeded from Cobalt.

However, the DSS call comes back to the WFE as a crash, so we tell the browser to retry.  The callstack for both the WFE and backend are below.  Net-net DSS needs to plumb back the right error to the WFE, so that the WFE can then show the right error to the customer.

@Alexandre Grigorovitch  the logs are confusing because the session that complained wasn't particularly relevant.  Another session from the user (e9f7f9ce-6c0b-43fe-a612-3af4f95fca2c) shows the actual problem they kept facing.

Anyway here is the exception the WFE sees.

Comments:
Changelist: 19026924

OfficeVSO:3353310 - Create IWetContentStoreListener interface to listen for RTM events

Explain Fix: Created IWetContentStoreListener interface

Clients will register with IWetContentStore to receive notifications when new Real Time Message is received and when the message is reverted in the wet content store.

This interface is needed for anchoring ModernComments to selected text. The ModernComment needs to know when the text body object to which it is anchored is modified, while processing an incoming RTM, so it can update it's anchors accurately.

Title: Ramp up on current workflow
xLanguage: Source ambiguity: Fit, Expand, Scale Drawing (Drawing canvas)
Description:
# XLANGUAGE TEMPLATE

Task

We need to flag and review strings related to Fit, Expand, Scale Drawing in the following area for all languages (see repro steps).

Review guidelines

Some languages had out-of-context translation for Fit, Expand, Scale Drawing.

When you insert Drawing canvas (which is area used for drawing) and you right-click it, you can access features Fit, Expand, Scale Drawing related to Drawing Canvas.

"Fit" (verb) will adjust the drawing canvas to fit the page.

"Expand" (verb) will make the drawing canvas bigger.

"Scale Drawing" (verb) will switch Drawing canvas into mode where you can adjust the size of it. "Scale Drawing" here refers to "Change the size of drawing"

 

Typical issue:

Ex. Translations does not fit Drawing canvas actions, e.g. when nouns are used instead of verbs also when translations are generally out of context (like "Scale drawing" translated as "scale for drawing" etc.)

 

Terminology consistency (yes/no): NO

###Language


Affected source strings

Word (Windows Desktop)

1) Fit

2) Expand

3) Scale Drawing

Repro steps (scenarios)

1) Word (Windows Desktop) > Draw > Drawing Canvas > Insert it > Right click it

2) Word (Windows Desktop) > Draw > Drawing Canvas > Insert it > Right click it

3) Word (Windows Desktop) > Draw > Drawing Canvas > Insert it > Right click it

 

ENGINEERING TEAM

Title: Add column to flight table to let flight update it's value without requiring reboot.
Description: Currently all flights require a reboot to take effect. However it doesn't have to be that way (depending on the code consuming the flight), we should let code opt in to updates without reboot. Furthermore when the endpoint calls the override flight API, we might want to return a bool on whether the flight took effect or not so they will know it requires a reboot.
Comments: @Alex Sobek I think after the last meeting we decided not to do this, does that sound right? please reactivate otherwise.

Please look into this in September after the current flighting work is done. Lets also enumerate all the kinds scenarios for flighting as Shawn had suggested to make sure we are covering all the bases:

"From: Shawn Temming <stemming@microsoft.com>
Sent: Wednesday, September 4, 2019 1:16 PM
Subject: Re: HxCore Flighting infrastructure improvements WAS: RE: OM flighting and HxCore initialize

 

I think it would be helpfully to enumerate the different scenarios we are trying to enable since I think the solution will be different for each of them.  I think for several of the scenarios we wouldn't want our flighting infrastructure involved at all."
See #3605299 for more background info on this.
@Alex Sobek FYI, not scheduled for now. We will do planning on the first week of September. Will let you know when this gets scheduled based on that.

Description:
@Shavinder if/when a user runs into RO-Open because of the first known bug,
incorrect values are cached. But the expectation is that once the user syncs to a fixed build, the incorrect cached values should be properly updated by the second open at most. So my theory right now is that we have a problem in our cache [if a user is stuck
in RO-Open on a fixed build]. But unfortunately telemetry is not enough to give me all the details, I need a set of logs to confirm.

Title: Add support of correct logging of multi-file opens
Description:
This was a called out in the v1 spec. In TmcOpenAttemptBackground there is a for loop where we can open multiple files along the same activity instance. But, this has unpredictable results in the context of a single operation/activity instance because it introduces multiple points of failure. I’d expect at least one telemetry confusion case to be coming out of this.

To repro, File->Open->Browse (via CFD) then multi select files for open.

OnePager link: https://teams.microsoft.com/l/file/2E5FBAF0-2835-4BD3-B958-CB8755D136CE?tenantId=72f988bf-86f1-41af-91ab-2d7cd011db47&fileType=docx&objectUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmicrosoft.sharepoint.com%2Fteams%2FWord76%2FShared%20Documents%2FWord%20File%20IO%2FOne%20Pagers%2FSupportingMultiFileOpensInTelemetry.docx&baseUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmicrosoft.sharepoint.com%2Fteams%2FWord76&serviceName=teams&threadId=19:1066f7449e964c3883f2d9dc4b9decc5@thread.skype&groupId=98086dfb-a21a-4dfc-ad04-2582f9f96528
Comments: This PBI now tracks work for CMD line and CFD multi file opens. See child tasks for breakdowns.

I'm unsure of how we'd like to break this up, so my understanding of scope is limited here. We flagged it as a difficult problem to address a few years back, so let's start with a conservative SWAG of 20. The idea is that we might have a general solution in the UserOperation that covers this specific case.

Title: Update Enable/Restore of Dpi Awareness with better design.

Changelist: 14612710

OfficeVSO:1587698 - Update Enable/Restore of Dpi Awareness with better design.

Explain Defect: Problem Description:

We have functionality/api that is used to set the dpi awareness as we wish to as a part of Dynamic Dpi job. Now the idea here is to restore the dpi awareness to the original state as and when we intend to change it to a desired value. This will make it consistent and is a better design approach.

Explain Fix: Resolution:

Added the api that restores the dpi context to the awareness the app is set at.

This would essentially be the integration of the Edge reports into the Action board, where they belong

Title: [SMIME]: Add ability to delete signing and encryption certificates
Description:
Add the ability to delete specific signing and encryption certificates from the user's device. 
https://ghe-us.microsoft.com/storage/user/1350/files/78ebe000-b92a-11e9-92a7-73d99bf6611c
Comments: Docs included in attached email.

Update from @Bryan Staats  Work is complete; documentation needs to be written and distributed. 
CC: @Corbin Reynolds

@Bryan Staats I think the client should explicitly ask Hx, which certificate to delete. We can show UI based on the certificate information and then handle the UI on our own, separate from the Hx business logic. cc @Nicolas Goles in case he has a different idea.

@Corbin Reynolds There is a work item to expose certificate information.  I guess the question is who is doing the deleting?  The client does the adding (importing) of certficiates.  Are they also doing the delete or do you want HxCore to do this.  I'm assuming deleting will not pop up UI which is why you do the adding.
@Bryan Staats I'm pretty sure this requires some Hx work to allow us to expose + delete certificates. Is that correct or should we have everything we need?

Title: OCV - Excel\Chart: Select Data Source dialog is not case sensitive for custom series names and category labels
Description:
This work item has been linked to an OCV Issue. Links to the OCV Issue can be found in the 'All Links' tab of this work item.

 

O14 - YES
O15 - YES
O16RTM - YES
Aug - YES
Main -

 

===========================
REPRO STEPS:
===========================
1. start IE
2. 1 in A1
3. create a simple 2d column chart
4. right click on the chart and select 'Select Data'
5. in the Select Data Source dialog, under Legend Entry (series), click Edit
6. in the Edit Series dialog, in the Series name field, enter "abc"
7. click OK, OK

 

8. right click on the chart and select 'Select Data'
9. in the Select Data Source dialog, under Legend Entry (series), click Edit
10. in the Edit Series dialog, in the Series name field, enter "ABC"
11. click OK, OK

 

12. (observe the series name in the legend)


===========================
BUG:
===========================
The series name is still "abc" (lower case)


==========================
EXPECT:
==========================
Expect series name to be "ABC" (upper case)

 

The only way to force the change is to enter a different string.

Title: Due: 07/28 (Awaiting Removal) Recent Issues Article Update: Outlook.com migration failures in Outlook 2016
Description:
PRODUCT PAGE: (e.g. Outlook for PC, Outlook.com)



ISSUE TITLE:

Outlook desktop issues when connecting to Outlook.com after upgrade [WORKAROUND]



ISSUE DESCRIPTION:

Email accounts ending in @outlook.com, @hotmail.com, @live.com, or @msn.com are powered by Outlook.com The below article includes fixes or workarounds for Outlook desktop customers (with linked Outlook.com accounts), who may be experiencing issues after upgrade to the new Outlook.com experience.

While the upgrade is in process, some customers will use the new Outlook.com while others continue to use the legacy experience. How do you know whether your account has been upgraded? Login to your account through a web browser and compare your mailbox with the images below.

MAILBOX PRE-UPGRADE

MAILBOX POST-UPGRADE

After you’ve been upgraded to the new Outlook.com, some of you may experience the following issues:

  1. Your Outlook.com email and calendar not syncing properly to your Outlook desktop

  2. You may notice some missing or renamed folders or hidden folders becoming visible

  3. You may experience some issues when searching for emails/contacts

  4. Autocomplete for contacts may not work properly

WORKAROUND

If after migration you see any of these problems, you can do the following workaround:

  • Preferred workaround: Create a new Outlook profile and add your account when prompted.

    NOTE: You should use this workaround if:

    1. Outlook.com is the primary or only account you are accessing via Outlook desktop.

    2. You are experiencing issues in using Search in Outlook desktop.

  • Alternative workaround: Users who have multiple accounts in a profile might prefer this workaround.

    1. First, remove your account from an existing profile. To remove the account follow the steps in the "Remove an email account you added to your Microsoft account" section of this article.

    2. Then re-add your Outlook.com account. To add the account back follow the steps in the “Automatically add your Microsoft account to Outlook” section of this article.

Note: When you add your account back (via File > Account Settings > Account Settings > Add), enter your Name, Email, and Password and let Outlook automatically configure it. Outlook will automatically add it as an Exchange account.


SHOULD THIS ISSUE BE COMMUNICATED IN AN ALERT AT THE TOP OF AN EXISTING SOC ARTICLE? If so, create a VSO Task at http://aka.ms/newsroom-socalert to get one created. See VSO tracking process - Alerts on existing SOC articles for more information.
Comments: This article belongs to the Outlook team and is not a Newsroom article to remove. it's a general topic about Outlook.com. Closing this item now as there is no action item.
https://support.officeppe.com/en-us/article/I-can-t-see-my-Outlook-com-email-in-Outlook-2016-or-Outlook-2013-cda1751d-9503-40bf-bf76-e79454ac5eb3?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US

Michelle, most of the Outlook.com issues are resolved and the rest are on the main page. the GUID in this bug goes to a page that Lindsay owns. cda1751d-9503-40bf-bf76-e79454ac5eb3. Not sure what this work items is about.

Title: Copying section takes very long time on UWP (was OneNote UWP)
Description:
Good feedback performance bugs and missing features.
Adding OneBug, William can comment on roadmap
On Apr 20, 2018, at 8:28 PM, David Brodsky wrote:
Hi Mike,
Congratulations on the education champ award! Well deserved.
I saw the blog posts on OneNote and the push for UWP. I’ve been trying to drink the Kool-aid but I keep running into challenges. Here’s what I recall just from today:
Tried to copy a section across notebooks. UWP spun dots for over 10 minutes before I cancelled. 2016 succeeded with no problem.
Wanted to copy an email from outlook and paste into an existing page. The paste just gave the title and envelope info rather than giving the option to paste content or as attachment. Works great in 2016.
Finally, I have a ton of notebooks from projects, teams, and various people. To keep track of what I need review I rely on Onetastic calendar. What is the equivalent solution for UWP?
I really want to make the switch and be a fan. Any solutions to help me make the switch?
Thanks,
-Dave
Get Outlook for iOS
Comments: I understand the problem disappeared unfortunately. Please try filing the feedback with perf trace next time you see it.

#1 ->Bug 2286038

#2 ->this bug

#3 -> Bug 2284123,

I see 3 feedbacks:

1. Copy pasting an Outlook item pastes "textified" version of the item. Win32 pops up a dialog offering to chose between inserting it as a file or printout.

2. Copy section is somehow taking very long.

3. Is there a onetastic calendar like solution to UWP?

Description:

Title: Ring:<1> App:Excel Mode:All - Ring Validation Pass: Manual Test Pass Status - TEST
Description: This is the bug that we should open every time we start a new Product Validation Pass in a Ring. Important things to remember: Use THIS template to log the Product Validation Pass status Update the title to say which Ring was the test pass done on (Ring 1 or 2 etc) , App (Word, Excel, OneNote or PowerPoint) and Mode (View, Edit) Fill the Opened Build with the right build#  Always ensure that the status of the Product Validation Pass is updated (As shown below) The different status are: To show that the pass has started please change the following values: State : Active and Sub-Status : In Progress  To show that the pass is completed and found NO ship blocking bugs State: Closed and Reason (filled by default) : Fixed  To show that the pass has completed and found SOME ship blocking bugs State: Resolved and Sub Status : Blocked
Comments: Auto Closing bugs that are resolved not as fixed after 14 days
Copied from Bug 2958565

Title: NLV: scrolling in a large document results in text and gridlines not rendering
Description:
I'm filing one bug for three issues with scrolling because they may all be due to the same issue. If not, we'll have to open new bugs.

Here are the issues. (See the attached video)
  1. Text sometimes doesn't render (could be the same as VSO# 1856940)
  2. Gridlines disappear
  3. The blue line that we draw for NLV to show there is content that needs to be scrolled shows in random places.
The text is what I'm most concerned about. If fixing that doesn't fix the gridlines and/or the blue line, then we will file one or two more bugs as needed.
Comments: Associated with change #15659637. Updated on behalf of nacrowel by Apex VSO client.
@Rebecca Poulson - Thanks. @Nathan Crowell, @Brent Lang - FYI
@Scott Roberts (APEX) - agreed.
@Rebecca Poulson - are you okay with not drawing the blue line in NLV documents when it needs to be scrolled? I'm okay with it. @Nathan Crowell, @Brent Lang
CodeFlow Review: [CodeFlow  Browser]

@Scott Roberts (APEX) - only issue left in this bug after the AirSpace changes is going to be the issue of the blue line.  Due to the change in the nature of how this view draws in response to scrolling, supporting the blue separator at the top when scrolled will I think require reworking entirely how it draws.  I have not thought extensively about alternatives but I think roughly something like a new layer off of the root directly to ensure that it is not affected by scroll position.  The current method is hooked in to updating the grid lines DRG which will no longer always occurs at each time scrolling occurs the way that would have been previously required prior to using AirSpace for NLV.

Given that it is non-trivial to keep the blue line, one alternative that I think @Brent Lang and I discussed previously is just getting rid of it entirely.  The scroll bars should accurately reflect scroll position and so having the blue line as an indicator seems redundant and perhaps not worth the effort to keep around.  This is what I will be putting a code review out to do as a resolution to this bug but I was not quite sure with whom all I should check about this change in design for the feature.

Issues 1 and 2 do seem to be duplicates of 1856940 as the fix for that bug causes them to be fixed.  

Issue 3 seems to be something different.  Need to track down what even draws the blue line and determine an appropriate fix.
BugBashNLV => NLV

Making this one blocked on 1856940 which describes a specific problem more concisely and might just be the source of all issues contained in this bug, but I am not sure of that enough to resolve as a dupe at the moment.
bulk moving unfinished work from September to October.
Airspace bug?
Rendering => Brent

Title: Editing: remove office-developer-exchange-docs topic
Description:
We are looking for the owner of this repo: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/office-developer-exchange-docs/


In particular, we have had multiple GitHub Issues coming in to the Exchange PowerShell repo because the cmdlet references point to this article: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/office-developer-exchange-docs/blob/master/docs/management/exchange-management-shell-cmdlet-input-and-output-types.md    

which is published here on docs: 

https://docs.microsoft.com/exchange/client-developer/management/exchange-management-shell-cmdlet-input-and-output-types


Years ago this document used to be maintained by someone in devdocs but it hasn’t been maintained in years so we would like to get it removed / redirected and we will remove the references from the Exchange cmdlets to it.
Comments:
Nothing to do here. Only cmdlets that are mentioned in this topic are linked to from Exchange cmdlet reference topics (approx. 900 out of 1200).

Closing
Changing to a task until there's work for me to do and assigning to @Chris Davis (EXCHANGE).

Title: [Universal] MSRC 42120. [Office - Outlook] Bypassing Safelinks in Office 365 ATP
Description:
This bug was automatically created by RDX's automated MSRC (security vulnerability) management tools. This bug is unique to your team, so do not close it without verifying that the reported vulnerability does not exist in your product/version/platform/app (even if the issue was initially reported against a different version/platform from yours). For more info on how to manage MSRCs, please see https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/office_rdx/office_releases/SitePages/MSRC_Security_Releases.aspx.

MSRC Note: Please see report attached. Finder Desc: Bypassing safelinks in Office 365 ATP In Office 365 ATP there is a function that will change every URL to a Safelink. A typical safelink looks like this: If you want to bypass this you can simply send an email like this: The first is only text, but when it is processed on the client side (Outlook) it is converted into a clickable link and therefore not inspected by safe link. The other that is a link will be converted to a safelink. In my testing it only happens if the user is using Outlook and this is not the case if you are using OWA.

Title = Xcode 11: crashes in OpenGL on iOS simulator when built using Xcode 11
Lowering Priority to 1 and removing Xcode11Blocking tag. ppt_ios test disabling bug 3605805 will remain blocking. @Trystan Larey-Williams FYI

@Amogh Vinod Aralimatti I've created a copy of the issue and pathed to PPT iOS for the short term workaround of disabling the tests. We (graphics) don't actually own these and would need their sign-off anyway. In the mean time, I'm actively working on the 'real' fix which I'm making good progress on. Probably just a couple - few days off.
This has been P0 for a while now. @Trystan Larey-Williams If ignore is the only option for now, can you please help unblock Xcode deployment by sending out a CR for this ASAP? thanks
Updating title so this can be our primary bug tracking this internally
@Sergei Zhenochin @Jonathan Holley Ignore for now seems to be the only option. I'm beginning work on migrating the simulator to Metal today. But it will be several days at least before that is ready.
@Jonathan Holley @Trystan Larey-Williams what do you recommend short term to unblock xcode11 deployment? Ignore the assert? Disable the failing test(s)? Anything else? Thanks

@Sergei Zhenochin this is really just a dupe of Apple bug: Bug 3564909: [iOS 13 XCode 11 OpenGL Simulator]: Crash in OpenGL stack when applying 3D effects in PPT

We should not crash when calling OpenGL in the simulator but do.  Our long term plan is to enable Metal support in simulator builds since that was just added in Xcode 11 and currently testing OpenGL in simulator is meaningless since we only use Metal on iOS hardware now.

@Trystan Larey-Williams has started looking into this but it's not a small project to convert over to Metal for simulator builds.
@Jonathan Holley are you/is anyone actively looking into it? Do you have any ETA? Thanks

In recent builds it is crashing at different place . it crashing in graphics.

In old build we were able to repro File save crash on device also. But in recent builds it happening on simulator only.

That too it is crashing on second save to file and second time launching slideshow and crashing in graphics. 


Repro steps: Ipad OS 13.0 (build using xcode 11 beta5 on Mojave –enlistment synced to 14 aug chekcpoint)

  Slideshow scenario

  1. Open a ppt file launch slideshow in presenter view. Exit slideshow.
  2. Launch slideshow in presenter view again. Observe that app is hung/crashed

File save scenario:

  1. Open a file , turn off autosave and add slide and click on save button .
  2. Add another slide and click on save button see that appcrashes.

Both crash with same callstack : in calling glclear from ClearRenderTarget method of DeviceOgl2.cpp


attached screenshots
@Bhavani Gadeela The bug you say is blocking this one ( #3564796 ) was resolved not-repro.

this assert(bdzl1) says the operation it is trying to do failed, i.e., it is waiting for event (MOX::IApplicationDocumentOperation::Type::Save) and it is not being hit.
Once vso 3564796 is fixed, then this tag wont be hit. so adding link to vso:3564796 as blocking bug.

It seems like we have 3 separate issues going on here. Splitting them out so that these can be dealt accordingly.
  1. This bug is a ppt test assert bug. So assigning to ppt to take a look at the ppt_ios test assert
  2. Created a new bug for crash on file close for CDocs (assigned to myself to take a look). VSO 3564796
  3. Created a new bug for the graphics crash & assigned to graphics. 3564787

looks like its a new file creation issue on either locally or in cloud. 
also the issue is only happening on Powerpoint

Title: Desktop (Windows) - Excel: sv-se: Short cut key Ctrl+§ doesn't work
Description:
#OLQC bug template (VSTS version)

Following template should only be used for bugs related to LinkedIn community

Please always report only one issue per template!

 

LinkedIn Discussion URL:

 

https://www.linkedin.com/groups/10318078/10318078-6411828193837223937

Office Product/App/Service Name:

 

Excel

   

Affected language:

Please select an option from VSTS Language drop down list.

Issue description:

 

The short cut key Ctrl+§ doesn't work for "Show formulas" in Excel 2016, 2013 and 2010 of the Swedish version. The short cut key Ctrl+§ for "Show formulas" works in version 2007 and all previous versions.

In English version the short cut key is Ctrl+` and works fine, but can't use it in the Swedish version.

 

Current Translation:

 

N/A

 

Suggested Translation:

 

N/A

 

Corresponding English Text (if known):

 

N/A

 

Steps to reproduce the error:

 

N/A

 

Reason for change:

 

See issue description

N/A

N/A

 

Screenshot/s:

 

Please do not forget to include screenshot/s in a form of an attachment/s.
Comments: Resolving as fixed. Shortcut has been updated in Excel and related article.

Replaced/fixed as requested Ctrl+` changed to Ctrl+$. 6/25 (from aprox. 11AM) change should be published live.

Regards, Katerina

Hello @Katerina Neoralova, could you please help to update it in Swedish article?
Thank you.

@Siobhan Ashton Have changed all keys to "Ctrl+§" in Fabric.
@Ondrej Vrana (Moravia IT AS (USD)) Could you please help to find somebody from UA team to change the Swedish help article( https://support.office.com/sv-se/article/kortkommandon-i-excel-för-windows-1798d9d5-842a-42b8-9c99-9b7213f0040f?ui=sv-SE&rs=sv-SE&ad=SE ) for the short cut key "Ctrl+§" for "Show formulas". Thanks.

Elaine, can you change all keys to Ctrl+§ - if you have no already validated this via a PR build please do.  Per Roger's comments the help article will also need to be updated.   I would suggest targeting this for July fork rather than rushing it for June.

I'm okay with changing this, just make sure ALL references in help content are updated in tandem with the software release. I could advise ensuring, if you change this for the June fork, you make sure the content guys can deliver within the same time frame, otherwise target this change for July.
Assigning to Roger to triage as Product Owner

I am but I would prefer Roger are Mr Excel to confirm he is OK before they make the change.
What say you @Roger Clarke ?
@Roger Clarke @Stafford Quaid Stafford based on what you said below about nobody knowing about Alt+5 - are you book OK to have Moravia revert all this keys to Ctrl+§"

Hi @Siobhan Ashton ，
We have tried you suggestions below: 
1. Revert the sixth key back to  "Alt+5" and changed the middle 4 keys to "Ctrl+§", then do PR build, the result is that still  "Alt+5" work.  
2. Changed all to "Ctrl+§", the result is that  "Ctrl+§" work. 
So We think the middle 4 keys make no affect, as Caiyan tried below, we only need to change the sixth key from "Alt+5" to "Ctrl+§", "Ctrl+§" will work.
Please triage whether we can fix this via leaf with changing the sixth key to "Ctrl+§", or for consistent, we need to change all the 6 keys to "Ctrl+§"?
Thanks,
Elaine
Hello @Elaine Qin. This is rather an older bug. Should this still be assigned to your alias?
@Elaine Qin , please have a try according to Siobhan`s comments.

Hiya @Siobhan Ashton thanks for all the investigation!
I really appreciate it!
We call out it should work in the UI with "Ctrl+§". 
I had a look at the Swedish help article on Excel shortcuts.
https://support.office.com/sv-se/article/kortkommandon-i-excel-för-windows-1798d9d5-842a-42b8-9c99-9b7213f0040f?ui=sv-SE&rs=sv-SE&ad=SE  
Funnily enough no mention of "Ctrl+§" and the only mention of Ctrl+Alt+5 is
"

Bläddra bland flytande former, som textrutor och bilder.

Ctrl+Alt+5 och sedan på TABB-tangenten flera gånger

which is 

Cycle through floating shapes, such as text boxes or images.

Ctrl+Alt+5, and then the Tab key repeatedly

so totally different"

So we never tell anyone that Alt+5  will work as far as I can see. No one knows.

FYA @Roger Clarke and @Stafford Quaid 

Looking at this, the key in Swedish was changed to Alt+5 post 2011 - why or when exactly it was changed I don't know.

I've have asked Caiyan to check if we can change the other keys so that both work as one is an alternative key.  

If that works all is good, however, if it does not, one will have to be selected - which could break they legacy experience for anybody who is using Alt+5.  I'll defer this decision to product owner Roger or Stafford you might want to round back with the community on this, to see if anybody used Alt+5.  

It may not come to that if the alterative key idkObjectCrtToggleFmlaVal_Alt1 - makes both a winner.  Just wanted to give you a heads up.  As an aside, there is a UI resources that Caiyan thought was a shortkey key set as Ctrl+§ so somewhere in excel we are referencing the shortcut as Ctrl+§ which might make this option the one to go for .

Just to clarify the first resource you listed is not a shortcut keys, its a UI string not a short cut key

xlintl32.rest

(maylau) OfficeVSO:1447063 - [Feb Fork]MSRC 36906. [Office - Word] Office Word - UAF wwlib!wdGetApplicationObject

Explain Defect: Although we have the right mechanism to deal with WM_CLOSE, sometimes we process WM_SYSCOMMAND with SC_CLOSE right when idle tasks call CidrContinueIdle - which can cause access to released HWWD/PDOD after controls are returned to the idle tasks.

Explain Fix: With this changelist, we will post a WM_CLOSE to the message queue when SC_CLOSE is received, instead of allowing the default window proc to close the window right away.

Title: WebScout Scan: Parameter Fuzzing (endpoint: /rtc2/signalr/poll)
Comments: Suppressed in WebScout

Marking as false-positive

The issue is not a security issue. Service is not using any query string parameters for database query or inserting them in any HTML page or JavaScript. Service is correctly returning the HTTP status code of 403, if user cannot be authorized. Service is using the parameter “qs”. Within this parameter are embedded 3 values which are “WopiSrc”, “access_token”, “access_token_ttl” which is extracted by the service and send to down level service which we call the host (Host are service like SharePoint, OneDrive, Dropbox…) which provides document storage. Host validate the parameters making sure token is valid, it has not expired, and user has access to the document. If host return to the service that token is valid and user has access to the document then user can carry out the API action called, otherwise service returns a 403 status back.​

Title: [Main -> 1808-Aug]: [O16 C2R] MSRC 45460. [Office - Outlook] Outlook - email from a compromised “safe sender” can cause undesired download of external content.
Description:
WHAT THIS BUG IS:
OSubmit has automatically filed this bug as to track submitting a milestone code change into another branch. This bug has already been submitted to team triage along with that milestone bug. Once the submission to this branch has happened, resolve and assign the bug to the original Opened By for the bug so they can verify it in that branch.

WHY IT WAS OPENED:
This Dependent Link bug associated with this bug was submitted to a milestone branch. Milestone submissions are NOT automatically integrated to other branches. Instead, new bugs are opened to track individual submission to each branch.
Tags: CoreUX-Reviewed; CoreUX-Shield; Exclude2019; OLKOneList; PM PreApproved
Comments:
(aalapc) OfficeVSO:2574169 - [Main -> 1808-Aug]: [O16 C2R] MSRC 45460. [Office - Outlook] Outlook - email from a compromised ΓÇ£safe senderΓÇ¥ can cause undesired download of external content.

Explain Defect: Receive and click on an SMIME signed/encrypted message from a safe sender and Outlook will download the external content by default. Due to the EFAIL security vulnerability in the SMIME protocol this might lead to the private key being inadvertently leaked if the mail is constructed just right

Explain Fix: MSRC - Block external content download for SMIME encrypted and signed messages and don't allow users to have a single-click way to download pictures or external content without changing TrustCetner settings

Notes: Tests run:

Default setting and Policy on:

- Verified for SMIME signed and encrypted messages that we by default block download of external pictures if the user is a Safe sender, regular sender, internal sender and external sender

- Verified we show the new UI strings in the Infobar (based on org policy or user setting) and don't allow it to be clickable to download pictures - one regression is we show this string for SMIME messages regardless of whether there's external content in them or not. Not ideal but to change that behavior will need a new blockState and a refactor of blkextutil functions

- Verified we show the new UI strings in the Wordmail body and we don't show "Download Pictures" as an option

- Verified we disable the "View in Browser" button to prevent exploits

- Verified regular messages go through the same old behavior of downloading external pics by default for safe and internal senders and block (and allow download) otherwise)

- Verified this works for Mail items and Post items

- Verified internal content (inline image) in HTML still continues to load correctly

Setting off:

- Verified for SMIME signed and encrypted messages if we uncheck the "Don't download" option in TrustCenter that we download external pictures if the user is a Safe sender, regular sender, internal sender and external sender

- Verified we revert to older UI to allow the user to download pictures from the Infobar and Wordmail body as well as the "View in Browser" option

Policy off:

- Verified for SMIME signed and encrypted messages if set the group policy to "Don't download" option in TrustCenter that we download external pictures if the user is a Safe sender, regular sender, internal sender and external sender

- Verified we revert to older UI to allow the user to download pictures from the Infobar and Wordmail body as well as the "View in Browser" option

PR Tester: aalapc

Updated details

In O365 Admin Center Preview UI, some strings aren't translated in 'Contacts', 'Guest users' and 'Partner relationships' page. For better understanding, we have added an English 'English reference.PNG' screenshot you can refer. Related untranslated strings: 'Nothing here yet', 'Let's get you started', 'There's nothing here' and 'And that's probably OK'.



Repro steps
1. Log in https://www.office.com/?auth=2&home=1 with local account(None subscription)
2. Click 'Admin' 
3. Click 'Preview on' button and go into the O365 Admin Center Preview UI
4. Click 'Users' ->Click 'Contact', if none contact, check strings
5. Click 'Guest users', if none guest users, check strings
6. Click 'Settings'->Click 'Partner relationships', check strings

Instructions for moderators (ver: 1.3)

 

STEPS FOR BUG EVALUATION

Please follow steps below to evaluate the bug:

 

1. If the feedback/issue in Description fields is not in English, please provide the translation under “Discussion” field

2. Decide if the feedback is valid:

 

2.1. If the feedback is not justified, change the state to “Resolved”, select “Not Repro” in the field “Resolved Reason” and provide the explanation in the “Discussion” field. Make sure to assign the bug back to “OISGMajordomo” alias.

 

2.2. If the bug is justified and the issue described can be located:

a. Choose “Ling” tab and fill in required fields:

• Linguistic impact

• DQF Error Type

• DQF Specific Error

• Root cause

• Additional comment (if necessary)

b. Decide if it is a world readiness issue (with high probability that the issue will apply for other languages as well). If yes, please provide a detailed explanation in a “Discussion” field and add new tag “xLanguage_candidate”

c. Decide if the issue is worth fixing in an already released products (Office 2016 + Office 2013) by using SE_S1 ; SE_S2 ; SE_S3 or SE_S4 tag. This only applies to issues, which contain tag SharePoint or where Release group equals Desktop (Windows). Please find more information about this process on the following site (focus on section B. NEW BUGS):

https://portal.moravia.com/prj/officegroup/Linguistics/ModeratorSection/Moderator%20Kit%20Mainstream/Instructions%20for%20backporting.aspx

d. Decide if bug affects an approved term in Term Studio and if GTC is required.

  1. If there is no approved term in Term Studio (the concept does not exist), tag the VSTS item with tag “TS_SourceTerm_Candidate”
  2. If GTC is required, file a request to the GTC list
  3. If source or targets does not have any Office products in P/T, tag the VSTS item with tag “TS_AddSourcePT_Candidate” or “AddTargetPT_Candidate”

    e. Decide if this is a consistency issue and evaluate how many occurrences need to be changed.

    f. Assess whether the “priority” is accurate by referring to the bug priority classification

     

    2.3 If the feedback is justified but the issue mentioned in the feedback no longer exists in files, describe the situation under the “Discussion” field, and assign bug to “VT_Moravia” for further validation.

     

    3. If you have doubts regarding the validity of the bug or need more information, please assign the bug back to “OISG Majordomo” alias and request more details under the “Discussion” field.

    4. If you need to review occurrences before deciding and you are unable to access Fabric or a file, you may assign the bug to VT_Moravia and ask the team to locate the occurrences for you. (Please note in case of UA (Articles), an Internet search can provide additional content – no Resource IDs are needed). Make sure to describe what steps have been taken so far under the “Discussion” field.

     

    STEPS FOR BUG RESOLUTION

Resolving UI bug

 

If the language moderator is 100% sure where to locate the string, then s/he implements the fix directly in LEAF FOR THE SPECIFIC PRODUCT/PROJECT only.

 

If you are unsure reach out to the LSX PM in Microsoft. Do not forget to always provide ResID and File Name under the “Discussion” field. Change the state to “Resolved” and assign the bug to VT_Moravia for regression. If language moderators are not 100% sure about the implementation results, they keep the bug as “Active”, provide the resolution in the “Discussion” field, and assign the bug to VT_Moravia, who will implement the fix instead.

Resolving UA bug

 

Language moderator adds the evaluation results in the “Discussion” field, changes the path to GSX/Modern Assistance/INTL Production/, as well as the appropriate sub-node, for example, IW_Articles, Templates, Video etc, and assigns the bug to VT_Moravia for implementation.

 

In any case (for both UI and UA bugs), the language moderator should simultaneously add/update Term Studio entries as necessary.

 

For more details on global term change, please refer to the GTC process:

 

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/OISGPortal/linguistic/Moderator%20Kit/Global%20Term%20Change%20(GTC).aspx

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/OISGPortal/linguistic/_layouts/15/start.aspx#/Moderator%20Kit/Term%20change%20management%20in%20TS.aspx

Unable to add new POP account or receive mail for existing POP account.


-------Bug report--------

Outlook Version

16.16.18120901 [PROD]

16.16.19041201 [PROD]

16.16.19051200 [PROD]

 

OS Version

10.14.2

 

Can support team repro? If you cannot repro this issue, please document your troubleshooting. – No

  1. Guided to add the same account on Apple Mail and check if the issue persists – It doesn’t
  2. Guided to use the same server settings on Outlook as shown on Apple Mail
  3. Probed to check if there is any antivirus installed on the Mac – There wasn’t any
  4. Guided to uncheck ‘Use SSL to connect’ and use ‘110’ port – Did not work
  5. Guided to change the authentication to ‘None’ – Did not work
  6. Guided to change the authentication to ‘Username and Password’ – Did not work

Title: Extra characters are added to the end of the pasted text from a copied cell
Description:
1. Insert some text in a cell.  Commit.
2. Tap on the cell and choose copy. (don't go in cell edit mode)
3. Switch to the Notes app. 
4. Tap into a note so that you can paste the copied cell.

Actual xlapp_ios: An additional newline gets inserted after the pasted text. The IP after paste comes in newline, and if you press backspace, there it seems that there are 2 extra characters added to the paste beyond the string that is in the cell.

Expectation: Should come in the same line.


Ported from Repro Steps:
12/15/2016 7:15 AMBug filed on "Verify that CCP works fine on comments."
Step no.ResultTitle
1.Failed

- Cut-paste\Copy single cell with comment and verify - YES

- Cut-paste\Copy range with multiple Comments and verify - YES

- Cross sheet behavior - YES

- Copy Entire sheet with Comments - no

- Cut-paste\Copy paste comment text from pane and paste elsewhere in cell\comment

Expected Result

Verify clipboard commands work fine

Comments: Copy pasting a cell without going into edit mode and then pasting it in comments is not aligned with other platforms.
Test Configuration:iOS (iPad)
ReproSteps:
12/15/2016 7:15 AMBug filed on "Verify that CCP works fine on comments."
Step no.ResultTitle
1.Failed

- Cut-paste\Copy single cell with comment and verify - YES

- Cut-paste\Copy range with multiple Comments and verify - YES

- Cross sheet behavior - YES

- Copy Entire sheet with Comments - no

- Cut-paste\Copy paste comment text from pane and paste elsewhere in cell\comment

Expected Result

Verify clipboard commands work fine

Comments: Copy pasting a cell without going into edit mode and then pasting it in comments is not aligned with other platforms.
Test Configuration:iOS (iPad)
Comments: this is by design. Excel uses tabular data hence excel adds tabs between every cell and a new line characters after every row.
Porting data from Repro Steps to Description.

Updated title and repro steps to show that this affects more than just comments.

Not a ship blocker, but we should get this fixed in April.
Repros on ipad mini,  checkpoint: 170224
No repro on iPad mini with 170219.

We should just make sure that the extra line is not being added to the clipboard to affect paste in other applications.  If it only happens when pasting to the comment, then we can Won't Fix this bug, due to low impact.
This seems to be a corner scenario and the impact is low.
Miramar allows paste in this scenario. But it doesn't add an extra new line. Updating the bug description and title to reflect only this issue.
I see the same behavior on Miramar also. Please update the test case.
Moving to Pallavi as it is a paste related bug.
VSOMonitor SprintRollover: Moving to current iteration.
VSOMonitor SprintRollover: Moving to current iteration.
Not related to comment as such. Related to context menu it seems.

Title: Memory Leak (yyzz) Asserts in Word and Excel
Description:
This is first callstack when Word calls Fini on Igx.

> wwlib.dll!IgxProxy::Fini() Line 17 C++
wwlib.dll!ARTH::CleanupOart() Line 524 C++
wwlib.dll!CleanUpForExit(int fDeleteGdiHandles) Line 1038 C++
wwlib.dll!AppQuitReturnIfNeeded(int wCode, bool fReturn) Line 841 C++
wwlib.dll!AppQuit(int wCode) Line 864 C++
wwlib.dll!FMainLoop() Line 1154 C++
wwlib.dll!FMain(HINSTANCE__ * hInstance, HINSTANCE__ * hPrevInstance, char * lpszCommandLine, int cmdShow) Line 686 C++
winwordd.exe!WinMain(HINSTANCE__ * hInstance, HINSTANCE__ * hPrevInstance, char * lpszCommandLine, int cmdShow) Line 150 C++

This is the callstack when Word calls Art::Fini.


This is not a case of mis-matching Init and Fini. It is a case of Oart calling into Igx without Init (after Fini for Igx is done once by Word).
@PowerPoint Mail2Bug – for opening a bug for this.

From: Jonathan Ko
Sent: Tuesday, January 9, 2018 9:12 AM
To: Sushant Sharma (PPT)
Subject: Re: Memory Leak (yyzz) Asserts in Word and Excel

Good find! If the DataObject really is the cause, then it sounds like we need W/X to do the same thing. (do you have call stacks of second Init / a bug with this info?)

Additionally, perhaps we can add an assert or log to help catch this in the future:
LEFT: //depot/devmain/igx/IgxProxy/IgxExports_Proxies.cpp#head
RIGHT: //depot/devmain/igx/IgxProxy/IgxExports_Proxies.cpp#head
5
namespace IgxProxy
6
{
7
static LONG igxProxyInitCount = 0;
8
void
__stdcall Init() MSONOTHROW
9
{
10
AssertSzTag( igxProxyInitCount == 0,
"More than one Init calls to IgxProxy", 0x0070a110
/* tag_a2keq */ );
11
CIgxComponentProxy::Init();
12
(void) InterlockedIncrement( &igxProxyInitCount );
13
}
14
15
void
__stdcall Fini() MSONOTHROW
16
{
17
if( igxProxyInitCount > 0 && InterlockedDecrement( &igxProxyInitCount ) == 0 )
18
{
19
EnsureIgxProxy().Fini();
20
ShutdownIgxModule();
21
}
22
}
COMMENTS: Seems like it's expected to allow multiple Init/Fini calls, as long as they are matched.

Maybe we can add logs to these or CIgxComponentProxy, then checking logs would make it easy to determine whether we had matching Fini for every Init?

From: Sushant Sharma (PPT)
Sent: Monday, January 8, 2018 6:29 PM
To: Jonathan Ko
Subject: Memory Leak (yyzz) Asserts in Word and Excel

We have several yyzz Asserts in SmartArts scenarios running with Word and Excel.

This is because of memory of a Singleton being initialized even after Igx shutdown is done.

For word and excel, the shutdown flow is:


IgxProxy::Fini();

// Must be before Art::Fini()
CHART::Fini();
ODFFini();


Art::Fini();

i.e, IGX is shut down before Oart. During IGX shutdown, all the IGX singletons are shut down as well.
But when OArt shutdown happens, it calls Art::DataObject::Fini(), which can re-initialize some singletons in IGX if we have smart art on the clipboard.
These singletons are then released when the process shutdowns. But the memory leak detection happens before that.

In PowerPoint, we don’t face this problem because we call Art::DataObject::Fini() before calling IgxProxy::Fini() followed by Art::Fini()


Art::DataObject::Fini(); // Must flush clipboard before flushing printers, or else we'll try to allocate typeface information.
PrPrinter::Fini();
// Must cleanup printers before Art::Fini, since the printer has GEL::Typeface references
OsfFini();
// Must cleanup Osf before Art:Fini since OsfDefaultSnapshotManager has Art::Blip references which needs to be cleaned-up


IgxProxy::Fini();
..

Art::Fini();

I am not sure what PowerPoint is doing is the right thing and should we do the same in Word and Excel.
What do you think?

-Sushant

OfficeVSO:2083510 - Memory Leak (yyzz) Asserts in Word and Excel

Explain Fix: Bug 2083510: Fixing few memleaks asserts from Word and Excel.

In Word and Excel, Oart is calling into the Igx code after the App has

uninitialized Igx. This is because Oart is trying to call

DataObject::Fini which is calling into Igx if SmartArt is on the

clipboard.

The fix is what PowerPoint does, which is to call

Art::DataObject::Fini() before calling Fini for igx or chart.

https://office.visualstudio.com/DefaultCollection/OC/_workItems?_a=edit

&id=2083510

Please check the bug for email conversation with the Oart forks.

This does not fix all the memleaks in the apps ofcourse but decreases

them by a significant count.

Sent: Thursday, January 11, 2018 9:30 PM
To: Shain Heuer <shainh@microsoft.com>; Alli Hirt <alcurley@microsoft.com>; Sushant Sharma (PPT) <sushsh@microsoft.com>; Trey Bagley <donba@microsoft.com>; OfficeArt Code Review Request <oartcr@microsoft.com>; OE M2B Svc Account (DO NOT MAIL) <oesvcm2b@microsoft.com>; Pratik Gogri <pratikg@microsoft.com>; Kailas Lokhande <kailasl@microsoft.com>

From: Kailas Lokhande
Sent: Thursday, January 11, 2018 6:32:29 PM
To: Shain Heuer; Alli Hirt; Sushant Sharma (PPT); Trey Bagley; OfficeArt Code Review Request; OE M2B Svc Account (DO NOT MAIL); Pratik Gogri
Subject: Re: Memory Leak (yyzz) Asserts in Word and Excel

 

Yes, Agree. Once all Apps / endpoints starts calling DataObject::Fini separately before Art::Fini, then there should not be need to keep it as a part of ArtInitFini.

 

Thanks,

Kailas

 

Get Outlook for iOS

From: Shain Heuer
Sent: Thursday, January 11, 2018 6:27:22 PM
To: Kailas Lokhande; Alli Hirt; Sushant Sharma (PPT); Trey Bagley; OfficeArt Code Review Request; OE M2B Svc Account (DO NOT MAIL); Pratik Gogri
Subject: RE: Memory Leak (yyzz) Asserts in Word and Excel

 

Agreed that DataObject::Fini likely needs to come first, but it begs the question whether this belongs in ArtInitFini as well since we now know it can exhibit this behavior.  Short term a fix should be made to add the above call ahead of the app-side Fini sequence of chart, igx, oart but long term I think we need to think more deeply about refactoring DataObject::Fini away from where it is currently being called inside ArtInitFini.

 

Thanks,

Shain.

 

From: Kailas Lokhande
Sent: Thursday, January 11, 2018 6:17 PM
To: Alli Hirt <alcurley@microsoft.com>; Sushant Sharma (PPT) <sushsh@microsoft.com>; Trey Bagley <donba@microsoft.com>; OfficeArt Code Review Request <oartcr@microsoft.com>; OE M2B Svc Account (DO NOT MAIL) <oesvcm2b@microsoft.com>; Pratik Gogri <pratikg@microsoft.com>
Subject: Re: Memory Leak (yyzz) Asserts in Word and Excel

 

As per my understanding. OArt is doing right thing here.. 

 

OArt Init And Fini happens in particular order specified in ArtInitFini. Whereas Igx is not part of this InitFini chain. Igx handles its own init and fini, IgxProxy::Init must be called after OArt is initialized i.e Art::Init is called and IgxProxy::Fini must be called before OArt is uninitialized i.e. before Art::Fini is called, this keeps OArt independent of Igx.

Since DataObject is part of ArtInitFini chain, so having object from components who maintains their own Init Fini (such as Igx) makes it difficult to maintain init fini order. So. IMO it makes sense to cleanup DataObject for such components before those are uninitialized, similar to what PPT is doing.

 

Thanks,

Kailas

+oartcr

Can anyone help out Sushant with a question about Init/Fini? It looks like the scenario is that Art::Fini has been called, but there is SmartArt on the clipboard and therefore we’re trying to call into OArt again.

Hi Trey, Alli,

I need some guidance from OART team. I am not sure who should be the right person.
In Word and Excel, Oart is calling into the Igx code after the App has uninitialized Igx.

The question is, is Oart doing the right thing here?
If yes, should Word and Excel call
Art::DataObject::Fini(); before calling Art::Fini()?

-Sushant

Title: Hide MAD counts from UX on global asset, deployment plan assets and app fly-out pages
Description:
• For Public Preview:
    • hide Monthly Active Device count columns from global asset and deployment plan assets and app fly-out pages. There are 4 places in total: AppUsage  (Web view)
      • We can hide from UX, stop pushing this data for this column, or do both

Why:

  1. the appUsage data collection by appraiser has become an unknown quantity for the appraiser team, as they have made new updates and de=prioritized testing on win7 / 8.1
  2. joining inventory and app usage suffers from orphan program ids, but unlike appHealth no heuristic or cleansing has been applied to the MAD counts on inventory path.
    The estimation is for 3 weeks to port the code over, test and refine the heuristic from appHealth to work on this scenario

    • Leave appHealth session and device metrics ‘as-is’. This is affected by orphan progID issues (not all usage data can be mapped correctly to apps). We had measured this last year and reduced the gap to under 20%, but isn’t actively monitored

Title: [FYI: Promotion Successful] Typing in Outlook is SUPER slow due to > 1 thousand UpdateTexture calls per second
Description:
Jason, I found and attached your PerfTrace thread.

@Bill is the Outlook perf contact. And
@Leo, I think you were looking into these typing issues on behalf of wwlib. And
@Dave McDonald, and his OOF list, because this looks like it may be an Airspace issue.

Jason’s new trace (the Repro trace in the feedback item) is showing a group of ten input delays of 6.7s – 8.4s. Obviously a really poor responsiveness experience. He is running a 8126 x86 C2R install of Office. I’ve determined this to be
the UpdateTexture issue that Leo opened an investigation backlog item for as Office:1370297. I’ll open a bug for this report and attach it to the PBI.

Title: Tables to charts in Designer
Description:
Goals:
  1. [DONE] Initial research / investigations of potential solutions.
    We have a working service prototype which reduces an input table to text cells, fetches chart recommendations via the Insights web service, and constructs basic charts from the results.
    The insights web service appears to work sufficiently, though we need to sync on expectations (perf, reliability) and release timeframes.
    As a backup solution, we have enlisted and built their VisualizationRecommendation module which provides the same functionality completely locally; this does bring in many new dependencies and files, so if we need to go this route it should be an internally-hosted microservice (like Text Analysis).

  2. [DONE] Architecture and functional design
    We worked with Kushal and Steve to understand Object Replace architecture, and prototyped the major components.
    We know how to call the Insights service for ML (preferable solution) and know how to run it locally (if necessary).
    We proved that inline chart construction in the (non-XL, without embedding .xlsx) service works, is stable and editable in Win32, and seems to render fine in Web as well.

  3. [DONE] Prototype is linked in the appropriate child work item.

  4. We are targetting September fork for Win32 support. There is very little Win32 code required -- in fact, just triggering the table request. The Intelligence service changes also should align with Sept fork release.
    However, as we intend to rely on Insights for the core recommendation functionality, release will depend on them.
Comments: Submitted CLs to a private branch. Closing PBI for now.

Changelist: 16243033

OfficeVSO:1787754 - Tables to charts in Designer

(Bugs were not resolved by this checkin.)

Explain Defect: 1787754: Tables to Charts in Designer; Part 2/2

This is the native side implementation, which does the chart creation and the insertion of charts onto the slide.

Explain Fix: This part of the .dpk does the following.

- Update the user's slide info by adding SuggestedChartInfo and remove all TableInfo's if there is are chart recommendations from Insights, so that we search for Chart blueprints.

- Create the chart from the Insights results, populating data and formatting it correctly.

- Insert the newly created chart onto the slide and return the chart suggestions to the user.

Notes: It works, end to end. Including for tables with 1 row of data.

Some outstanding work items:

Use the IsMixing().

Get series names from insights and use those.

Reviewer: dimangal;sagarp;yangche;shvijay;jonko;pptcrbot

Codeflow ID: 192424

Trigger overrides: osubmitdepot;

This checkin occurred with local OACR errors. This changelist submitted with unprocessed OACR queues.

Changelist: 16242818

OfficeVSO:1787754 - Tables to charts in Designer

(Bugs were not resolved by this checkin.)

Explain Defect: 1787754: Tables to Charts in Designer; Part 1/2

Work: This is part 1 of 2 of the work (i.e. steps 1-4):

This is the initial work for the Tables to Charts work in Designer.

Essentially, we wish to take tables on the user's slide, send the table to the Insights service and get chart recommendations from it.

Explain Fix: The work flow goes like this:

1. Extract the table from the user's slide.

2. Send the table to the insights service. We need to make several calls to the Insights service. The first 2 calls are to send the table to the service. The 3rd call is to check if insights is done processing, and then the 4th call is to get the results from the Insights service.

3. Right before we call ProcessUserSlide() from the managed slide, we make the 3rd and 4th calls to check if Insights has finished.

4. Take the response Json from Insights and serialize it according to the interface specified in the .bond file and pass it to the native side.

5. Update the user's slide info by adding SuggestedChartInfo and remove all TableInfo's if there is are chart recommendations from Insights, so that we search for Chart blueprints.

6. Create the chart from the Insights results, populating data and formatting it correctly.

7. Insert the newly created chart onto the slide and return the chart suggestions to the user.

Notes: Putting this in a private branch for now.

There are still some outstanding work items:

1. We need to move the 3rd and 4th calls to the Insights service so that they are made as late as possible. This is so that we don't have to make the Designer thread sleep for as long while we wait for Insights (or at all hopefully).

2. Insights is not returning Series names, so we cannot create Series names for the charts.

Validation:

It works end-to-end on a simple table. There are still some perf considerations -- how long does it take for Insights to give us results. We've added some logging to see how long we have to sleep before we get results from Insights.

The work is all behind a brs. We do not give Table results if there are no Insights recommendations. We do send requests to Insights when the Brs TableAnalysisEnabled is turned off.

Reviewer: dimangal;sagarp;yangche;shvijay;pptcrbot

Title: Setting TextToDisplay to empty string will remove the hyperlink (change in behavior from O16 RTM)
Description:
Repro: Run the following macro in Excel

Sub AddHyperlinkAndChangeTextToDisplay()
ActiveCell.Hyperlinks.Add ActiveCell, "http://www.bing.com"
MsgBox "Hyperlink count: " & ActiveCell.Hyperlinks.Count
ActiveCell.Hyperlinks(1).TextToDisplay = ""
MsgBox "Hyperlink count: " & ActiveCell.Hyperlinks.Count
End Sub

Bug: Hyperlink is gone (i.e. Hyperlink count in second msgbox is 0) after setting TextToDisplay to "" (using 16.0.8127.1000, but probably introduced earlier)


Expect: In 16.0.4266.1004, hyperlink remains (i.e. Hyperlink count in second msgbox is 1). TextToDisplay set to http://www.bing.com


Investigation notes: Haven't done an in-depth investigation. Looks like in some cases (OM and paste html), we set pxhl->m_szDisplay to nullptr, which is what HrHyperlinkSetTextToDisplay falls back to when a null/empty string is provided.


In case of paste HTML, CL 13428963 sets the cell value and passed nullptr for display string when calling IxhlCreateHlink from HtmlStoreData::HrSetSingleCellData. Not sure if above OM scenario was taken into account when the behavior changed.

// Note: Original shared HTML code set cell value and hyperlink at same time through IxhlCreateHlink, which is a lot slower.

// Now we set cell value directly here and pass nullptr for display string when calling IxhlCreateHlink.

// Note: Since we no longer use IxhlCreateHlink to set the cell data, we are no longer forced to use the hyperlink

// for cell data if there is no hyperlink display text/cell data. Because legacy code is inconsistently allowing empty cells

// to have hyperlinks, we choose to make the behavior consistent and add hyperlinks only when the cell has text.
Comments: Verified that this is back to O16 RTM behavior

Changelist: 14969307

OfficeVSO:1606450 - Setting TextToDisplay to empty string will remove the hyperlink (change in behavior from O16 RTM)

Explain Defect: VSO.1606450 - Setting TextToDisplay to empty string will remove the hyperlink

In some OM scenarios we can create hyperlink where m_szDisplay is null,

then if we try to set TextToDisplay to empty string "" a nullptr is sent to HrPutRgchInSheet which cause it to delete the hyperlink,

this is change of behavior from before CL 13695250 (12/16/2016)

In these specific scenario reverting to the behavior to what it was before.

Explain Fix:

Notes:

1. Executed the VBA script in VSO.1606450 - verified old behavior is back

2. Tested the VBA script on coauth - the hyperlink is communicated to the other endpoint properly

3. added test case

PR Tester: gulevin

Reviewer: tomhoke;marisec;jamaiolo

BB Job Comments: xlt -xld

Trigger overrides: osubmitdepot;

Root cause was introduced in 12/16/2016 @ CL 1369250 (implement support for hyperlink RR),
there was a change in obhlink.c HrHyperlinkSetTextToDisplay() inside the else case to handle empty friendlyname strings.

not sure if that change was actually needed or optimization? seems like qianweli is no longer at the company,
@Jim Maiolo is written as reviewer, do you recall what is the reason to remove call to  IHlink::GetFriendlyName and use pxhl->m_szDisplay?
thanks

Title: [VaaS] Art-AltTextLocalized check error: Occurs multiple times for same LocFileID + contains incorrect metadata
Description:
Issue: 
[icms_office].[LocFileValidationResults] table contains the same check for the same LocFileID multiple times. These checks also contain incorrect metadata like:
  • IsChild = 1 for Title-Localized check. while title comes from parent/manifest
  • RunDate for all these checks equals

Examples:
see result of this query as a one example, also see attached screenshot:
SELECT *
  FROM [icms_office].[LocFileValidationResults]
  WHERE [LocFileID] = '11459244'
  ORDER BY [ValidationResultID],[Name]

Expected result:
[icms_office].[LocFileValidationResults] contains only one unique Validation Result per LocFileID/Category Name with correct metadata.
Comments: Moving to the new team for engineering work so we can deprecate old paths.
You are right, John, thank you, closing this bug.

There is no duplication of data. Vaas validates multiple items in a loc file. This can be seen when you include the Vaas attributes in the result set.

SELECT 
v.LocFileId
,v.FileId
,v.name
,v.Message
,vvra.[Key]
,vvra.[Value]
FROM 
[icms_office].[LocFileValidationResults] v
inner join
[icms_office].[VaasValidationResultAttributes] vvra on vvra.ValidationResultId = v.ValidationResultId
WHERE 
[LocFileID] = '11459244'
order by
v.name
,v.Message
,vvra.[Value]
Setting Pri 2 as it was not specified

Title: Browser code for text clear formatting
Comments:
Changelist: 19807402

OfficeVSO:3697051 - Browser code for text clear formatting

Explain Defect: First of series of changes for adding clear formatting to PowerPoint Online

Explain Fix: Sets a property on the TextRun denoting that clear formatting has been pressed. Managed code will look for this property to determine whether a request should be sent to the server to clear formatting. CL also includes the updating the multi-line ribbon, adding command mapping for the single line ribbon, and adding a setting to enable clear formatting. Additionally, moved shared error checking for user's current selection to a helper function behind a separate BRS setting.

Follow up CLs to come for correcting clear formatting button position in multi-line ribbon, browser side handling for shapes, managed code, and native code changes.

Link to design doc here: https://microsoft-my.sharepoint-df.com/:w:/p/brbehrba/ERcDQ73mEqZChaEEUa_WN7wB9AUJovfNiXuuz_Xf4mSN2w?e=wqwT61

Notes: Passed local testing, pods\test.ps1, and BB tests

Reviewer: pptcrbot

BB Job IDs: 379433926

Codeflow ID: 767321

Trigger overrides: osubmitdepot;

[CodeFlowLink]
Id = 773366
Url = http://codeflow/extensions/launcher.html?server=https:%2f%2foffice.visualstudio.com%2f&projectId=35d89fa2-df50-4442-9cb8-cc8679898172&reviewId=773366&projectshortname=OE
Title = Browser side changes for clear formatting on Text Ranges and Insertion Points

Title: Create the LanguageModel class
New OneDrive-centric Windows Storage Sense article
Description:
Request from PM for a OneDrive-centric article around Storage Sense that essentially converts this blog post https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/filecab/2018/08/30/9205/ into a full-fledged official article that then gets the full benefit of Localization into all our languages. 

When we do this, we'll need to translate some of the MS-internal and techie language, like changing "dehydrate" to "free up space" or "turn your files into online-only files"

I had planned to make some updates to the Files On-Demand article to account for the Storage Sense updates as well. If we create this article, we can probably just link to it from the Files On-Demand article.
