Title: Win_WAC_Excel :- No real time sync-up between 2 browsers for comments in shared excel workbook & error pop-up message is displayed.
Description:
Test URL: https://www.officeppe.com/

Platform: Windows & MAC

Repro in Browsers: IE 11, Chrome, Mozilla, Safari

Repro in PPT, Word : No

Build Version -16.0.10229.35903

Session Id :- 5b1574b3-2d75-4da4-a962-d5c59264f106

 

 

Steps to Repro:

1. Launch Browser in two separate machine

2. Hit the URL https://www.officeppe.com/

3. Open shared Excel workbook on both machines

4. Go to Review tab --> Click on New comment in (Safari browser) --> Enter the comment in 1st machine & Post it. And, on 2nd machine (Chrome Browser) click on New Comment.

6. Observe the behavior. (No Real time synchronization happen during Co-Auth sharing of an excel worksheet.)

 

 

Actual Result:

No Real time synchronization happen during Co-Auth sharing of an excel worksheet (Comments).

Also, system displays below message: -

 

Can't upload

Something is wrong, and your changes can't be merged with changes made by someone else.

  

Expected Result:

Real time syn-up should take place during Co-Auth sharing for excel worksheet for every comment being shared.

 

Attachment:

Video showing the incorrect behavior in excel sheet is uploaded.

Title: Global: APEX: devmain Job [Daily Build Slice] is Overdue on ob-osxbtw-36056.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com
Description:
Getting a bug logged so we can talk about getting this into the standard tiered workflow.

-C


From: Robert Guay
Sent: Wednesday, November 16, 2016 9:00 AM
To: Chad Martin ; Rodney Reagor
Subject: Re: Global: APEX: devmain Job [Daily Build Slice] is Overdue on ob-osxbtw-36056.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com

99 times out of 100 abort the leg.

Flow up is a little be trickier.
Loop or rolling build, abort and do nothing more. If it’s an issue it start to be apparent in future iterations.ApexMain Daily(s). Typically, you want to retry the leg in the in BuildTracker.Devmain slices. Re-queue from BuilderUI.
Will kick of a new job in BuildTracker.

By opening the log in
Yellow below you should be able to scroll to the bottom and see if it’s really stuck. Once in a while these will trigger just because it’s running slow but that should be apparent by the time stamps. I would say if there is nothing new logged an hour
or more it really is stuck and can be aborted.

You are right they frequently don’t correspond to tickets. The monitor doesn’t catch a lot of stalls but the BuildTracker notification do catch many of the things the Monitor can’t so that’s why we have this. Ideally, they should be in
the monitor but it’s not been apparent what to grab from the DB.

There has been mention before of tier 1 monitoring these. Adding them to the notifications would be easy. We have no TSG but that would be easier than figuring out the DB situation. There has already been at least 2 attempts to find
it in the DB that I recall.

Thanks,
Robert


From: Chad Martin
Date: Wednesday, November 16, 2016 at 8:24 AM
To: Robert Guay , Rodney Reagor
Subject: FW: Global: APEX: devmain Job [Daily Build Slice] is Overdue on ob-osxbtw-36056.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com

In general what are we supposed to do with these mails? It doesn’t appear that we have tickets that correspond to these mails. Should we get tickets so tier 1 can take action on these overdue builds?

-C

Title: LSXOXO :: EOL Expansion project for the 3 Variant cultures across Win32; MAC & iOS [Q2]
Description:
SWE ask for Win32 setup authoring work required to create the sku.



  • Intl Setup Authoring effort:
    • For MAC/iOS platforms, the effort will be managed by ‘imaceng’ team (Ursula) and is a simple process of adding culture tags to build scripts
    • Feature 2248623 (currently assigned to Ahmad) is tracking this effort for the Win32 platform
      • Confirmed as not part of Q1 effort and recent discussions indicate possible Q2/Q3 work item
      • Asad to come back with a date to go to market for the release to help drive clarity around when this work should be considered
      • Asad to come back with clarification around the list of SKU’s needing authoring for these variant cultures
  • Localization planning effort:
    • EOL settings and intl source seeding effort completed in early May as precursor to enable actual Localization start in late May
    • Localization work started in late May as per request of BPO team to front load Loc cost into Q4 of FY18
    • Localization effort still ongoing across all platforms (currently blocked by Bug 2411698 which is assigned to SWE to investigate)
      • Continuing to monitor this bug and work with SWE to mitigate
    • NOTE: For Win32 platform more EOL choices may be required depending on final SKU choices selected
  • Content/Templates effort
    • Smaller amount of content/templates published for MAC/IoS platform compared to Win32 platform
      • No categorization on content for MAC/IoS platform.
      • Templates should be there already for variants (more or less…Alfred to check)
    • For Win32, dependency on a Classification effort (scoped to 1 weeks effort) required to help decision making
      • Classification helps identify ‘Red zones’ i.e. content not in the target culture which possibly should be
      • Expect to review and agree Win32 delivery requirements at end of Q1 (Alfred, Asad, Alan)
        • Asad will help make budget call on any new content we may need to offer
    • NOTE: its agreed that delivery of content/templates should/will not impact/impede release as backfill with appropriate culture content can happen post release if necessary!
  • Validation planning effort:
    • All platform validation planning is started
    • Expect validation and bug fixing cycle to not exceed 2 weeks per platform
    • Win32 validation plan will centre around Sanity and integration testing only

Project dev\data

Tenant: Exchange15

Source: Could not find any database which can fit mailbox for soft policy violation.
Resource ID 0;"Microsoft.Exchange.Data.MailboxLoadBalance.Resources.Strings.resources"\0;"Strings"\0;"ErrorInsufficientCapacityForSoftPolicyViolation"
Relative File Path dev\data\drop\Retail\amd64\TBLOC\microsoft.exchange.data.mailboxloadbalance.dll.lcg
Project dev\data
Subtenant default
Tenant: Exchange15

Question: Hi,
This query is entered on behalf of Oleg Karnaushenko so please assign the answer to v-olkar@microsoft.com. Thanks.

We are not sure about the meaning of the "soft policy violation". Do we assume correctly that this is "a violation of a soft policy", or is it "a soft violation of a policy"? Also, if the former is the case, could you please explain what "soft policy" means exactly so that the translators can translate correctly?

Thanks,
Petra (on behalf of Oleg)
Tags: ad_hoc; dev\data; Release; Source - Source ambiguity; String Context; Supplier Support; validation; Vendor Context Query; Waiting on Core Dev
Comments: Moving under a new path as per #2705035

From Dev:
It means violation of a soft policy. Regarding what a policy is, a policy is a concept in LoadBalance service, which tells the service to move the mailbox for various reasons like feature upgrade, constraint violation etc. Some policies are strict as in it is a strict requirement to move the mailbox while others are soft policies which dictate a better place for mailbox to live in.
Created core bug Bug 840870

Localisers are missing some context for a string that is currently in translation. In order to translate the content of this string correctly, localisers require some help to understand the meaning of the source text.Please refer to the description/repro steps field where you'll find information on the affected string(s) and the question that requires your or the dev team's input.Strings with an open query remain at TRAP 4-ReviewerMoreInfo in Fabric as per agreement with the Linguistic Governance team.They will only be signed off and validated once the question is resolved, and the translation could be updated. It is therefore key that the localisation teams receive an answer in a timely manner, so that there is no undue delay in completing the full localisation cycle.
